{{OPSection
|sectionName=Attributes
|sectionSummary=Every cell in a Table component is described by attributes in a DAT table describing its font, size, color, etc.  These attributes may be located in different tables.  For each cell in the table, attributes are first searched in a corresponding cell attribute table, followed by a row attribute table, followed by a column attribute table, finally followed by a table attribute table.

These attribute tables are themselves found using a second level of lookup tables, that use the current state of the cell for that lookup.  The possible cell states are:
* default
* rollover
* select
* selectrollover
The state of each cell can be examined with an Info DAT.


The attribute tables are organized as follows:
* Each row describes one attribute.
* The first column is the attribute name.
* The second column is an optional path to a [[#Value Tables|table of values]] for this attribute.
* If the second column is blank, then the remaining columns contain the values for this attribute.


The current list of available attributes are:

* '''type'''                t               (field/label)
* '''fieldtype'''           t               (float/string/integer)
* '''setpos'''              b x y           (sets cell's absolute position in pixels when b=1)
* '''width'''               w               (sets cell's width in pixels, -1 is stretchy)
* '''height'''              h               (sets cell's height in pixels, -1 is stretchy)
* '''offset'''              x y             (cell position offset in pixels)
* '''padding'''             l r b t         (cell padding in pixels)
* '''margin'''              l r b t         (cell margin in pixels)
* '''bgcolor'''             r g b a         (background color)
* '''borderacolor'''        r g b a         (border A color)
* '''bordera'''             l r b t         (border A color edge source:  0=off, 1=bordera color, 2=borderbcolor)
* '''borderbcolor'''        r g b a         (border B color)
* '''borderb'''             l r b t         (border B color edge source:  0=off, 1=bordera color, 2=borderbcolor)
* '''fontpath'''            path            (Path to font. Don't use with 'font')
* '''font'''                string          (e.g. Verdana. Don't use with 'fontpath')
* '''fontsize'''            x [y]           (X size followed by optional Y size)
* '''fontcolor'''           r g b a         (Font color of text)
* '''fontformat'''          string          (polygon/outline/bitmap)
* '''fontbold'''            b               (0/1)
* '''fontitalic'''          b               (0/1)
* '''fontantialiased'''     b               (0/1)
* '''fontcharset'''         string          (ansi/symbol)
* '''textlabel'''           string
* '''textjustify'''         h v             (left/right/center top/center/bottom)
* '''textoffset'''          x y             (text position offset)
* '''wordwrap'''            b               (words are split over multiple lines: 0/1)
* '''image'''               path            (path to background, TOP)
* '''help'''                path            (path to rollover popup help text, DAT)
|opFamily=COMP}}
{{OPSection
|sectionName=Value Tables
|sectionSummary=If a path to a table of values is specified, then this table consists of one row for each cell.  If your table is not in this format, it can be modified easily.  For example if the value table DAT has 3x2 cells, append a [[DAT to CHOP]] followed by a [[CHOP to DAT]] .
In the CHOP, set the following parameters:
* Output: 'Single Channel'
* First Row is: 'Values'
* First Column is: 'Values'
This will produce a table with 1 column and 6 rows as required, providing all the values are numeric.
|opFamily=COMP}}

{{Summary |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |opLabel=Text |opClass=textCOMP_Class |opFilter=False |opLicense=TouchDesigner Non-Commercial |opCategories= |short=The Text COMP is a [[panel]] used to display read-only text or editable text. |long=The Text COMP is a [[panel]] used to display text for building user interfaces. The text can be view-only, view-only but copy/pasteable, or be fully editable directly in the panel. There are '''formatting''' modes for displaying single-line strings and multi-line text, floating point and integer numbers, password fields and more. The source of the text comes from the Text parameter and it is then formatted for display in the panel. Formatting examples include displaying a number as a currency, percent or scientific notation, or converting an integer timecode value to hours/minutes/seconds/frames. Other formatting options include support for Python syntax, Custom C++ Fmt and Custom Python F-String syntax. When a user clicks in the panel to edit the text, the contents are displayed in a raw format and then formatted again once the editing is completed. The Text COMP supports '''[[Text Formatting Codes|inline formatting directives]]''' in the text for things like color, strikeouts, underlines, small caps, subscripts, gradients, etc. For example, the code {#color(255, 0, 0);} will turn all text that follows on that line red. It has '''text-fitting''' options for wraparound, shrinking text if it doesn't fit, left-center-right alignment and language reading direction. View-only text can be selectable or not selectable. You can draw '''multiple transformed/formatted strings using a "Specification DAT" table''': It draws one string per row of the table, each with its own position and formatting in your panel. Columns can be x, y, text, fontsize, fontcolorr, fontcolorg, fontcolorb, fontalpha, skew, tracking and horzstretch. It has '''python callbacks''' that can be executed for every character or string that has changed, and a callback for change of focus. '''Resolution-independent text''' is drawn directly to the screen at the resolution required for the panel size, resulting in perfectly crisp text at all zoom levels. It is GPU-based using the [[Slug Library]]. Units for X, Y, Width and Height are in "'''panel units'''" whereas they were actual pixel units before. Default Font Size, Text Offsets and Padding are in panel units. See [[Text Formatting Codes]] See also [[Geo Text COMP]] for the 3D rendered equivalent of the Text COMP. Note: The Text COMP is a replacement for the [[Field COMP]], completely replacing it and adding many new features not previously available. }} {{ParameterPage |opFamily=COMP |pageName=Text |pageSummary= |items={{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Mode |parName=mode |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=0 |parSummary=Controls whether the contents are taken from the Text parameter or from a Specification DAT/CHOP. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=mode |itemLabel=Text |itemName=text |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=mode |itemLabel=Specification DAT/CHOP |itemName=specdat |itemSummary= }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Text |parName=text |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parOrder=1 |parSummary=This parameter is the data source for the text that is displayed in the panel. The value may be a number, string, or a reference to an external data source using a python or bind expression. When the text is edited by the user in the panel, those changes will be saved back to this value or to the original data source it is bound to. For example, you can bind the text in the panel to the contents of a DAT cell using a bind expression like 'op('table1')[0,0]' |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Specification DAT |parName=specdat |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parOrder=2 |parSummary=A path to a Table DAT that is the source of the text data when in Specification DAT mode. The table should have 3 columns labeled x, y and text in their first rows. Each row after that will display one line of text at the given x, y coordinates as measured from the bottom-left corner. x and y are measured in panel units. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Specification CHOP |parName=specchop |parType=CHOP |parReadOnly= |parOrder=3 |parSummary= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Type |parName=type |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=4 |parSummary=The Type parameter controls how the value is interpreted and as well as what formatting and editing options are available. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=type |itemLabel=String |itemName=string |itemSummary=The value is interpreted as a single line of text. If the source text contains multiple lines, they will be appended into one line. This mode is useful for simply labels or as an input field for data. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=type |itemLabel=Float |itemName=float |itemSummary=The value is treated as a floating point number before it is formatted for display in the panel. When editing, only numeric digits are accepted. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=type |itemLabel=Integer |itemName=integer |itemSummary=The value is treated as a whole integer number before it is formatted for display in the panel. When editing, only numeric digits are accepted. Integer mode can be used for formatting time codes and other whole numbers. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=type |itemLabel=Multi Line |itemName=multiline |itemSummary=Use this mode when displaying longer text that spans multiple lines. Lines are broken by a new line character (\n), or they can be set to wrap at the bounds of the panel. Note: Use expression mode for the Text parameter when entering new line characters using the '\n' escape sequence. Escape sequences are ignored and treated as literals when the parameter is in constance mode. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=type |itemLabel=Password |itemName=password |itemSummary=Use this mode to simulate a password box where the formatted text is replaced with dots. Note: While the password is not visible in the panel, it is not secure and is still displayed in the value parameter and is accessible with python. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=type |itemLabel=Specification DAT |itemName=specdat |itemSummary=In this mode, the Text parameter is ignored and data is taken from a DAT table given in the Specification DAT parameter. This mode can be used for displaying multiple single line strings at arbitrary locations inside the panel. This mode does not support editing the text directly in the panel. The table must contain at least 3 columns labeled x, y and text in their first rows. Each subsequent row will display one line of text at the given x, y coordinates. x and y are given in panel units measured from the bottom-left. The alignment parameters can be used to position the text relative to each x, y point. }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Formatting |parName=formatting |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=5 |parSummary=This parameter controls how the source text is is formatted and displayed inside the panel. The options available will change depending on the selected mode. For example, in Float mode there are options for scientific notation or percentage, while in Integer mode there are options to treat the source value as a time code. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=formatting |itemLabel=Default |itemName=default |itemSummary=This option is available in all modes and applies minimal formatting to the source value. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=formatting |itemLabel=Custom (Fmt Syntax) |itemName=customfmt |itemSummary=The text value is formatted using the c++ Fmt syntax where the source text is value 0. In Float mode, the width is also available as value 1 and the precision is value 2. See the [https://fmt.dev/latest/syntax.html Fmt documentation] for more details. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=formatting |itemLabel=Custom (Python F-String Syntax e.g. {val} ) |itemName=customfstring |itemSummary=The text value is formatted using the Python F-String syntax where the source text is available in the variable 'val'. In this format, anything between the curly braces is treated as a python expression, which allows easy mixing of literal text and dynamic expressions. }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Custom Formatting |parName=customformatting |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parOrder=6 |parSummary=This parameter provides the formatting string for custom modes like Python F-String and C++ Fmt. In both cases, the source text is defined inside curly braces ( {} ) while text outside the braces is treated as constants. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Precision |parName=precision |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parOrder=7 |parSummary=Used in Float mode to set the number of decimal places. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Thousands Separator |parName=thousandsseparator |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=8 |parSummary=Used in Float and Integer mode to add a separator between thousands to make it easier to read large numbers. For example 1,000,000 |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=thousandsseparator |itemLabel=None |itemName=none |itemSummary=Do not add a separator. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=thousandsseparator |itemLabel=Space |itemName=space |itemSummary=Use a half space character to separate thousands i.e. 1 000 000 }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=thousandsseparator |itemLabel=Comma |itemName=comma |itemSummary=Use a comma to separate thousands 1,000,000 }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Framerate |parName=framerate |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parOrder=9 |parSummary=Sets the number of frames per second when formatting integers into time codes. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Use Smart Punctuation |parName=smartquote |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=9 |parSummary=Enables the use of smart punctuation. For example, pairs of quotes will be replaced with appropriate angled quotes, 3 periods will be replaced with an ellipses character and two hypens will become an em-dash. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Formatting Codes |parName=formatcodes |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=10 |parSummary=Enables the use of formatting directives in the text. For example, the code {#color(255, 0, 0);} will turn all text afterwards on that line red. See [[Text_Formatting_Codes|Text Formatting Codes]] for all available codes. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Smart Punctuation |parName=smartpunct |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=11 |parSummary=Enables the use of smart punctuation. For example, pairs of quotes will be replaced with appropriate angled quotes, 3 periods will be replaced with an ellipses character and two hypens will become an em-dash. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Word Wrap |parName=wordwrap |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=12 |parSummary=Enables word wrap and can only be used when the 'Type' parameter above is set to 'Multi Line'. Word wrap will split single lines of text onto multiple lines when they extend past the edge of the panel. The panel width is based on the Width parameter minus the left and right padding. Lines are generally broken at spaces, tabs or hypens, but can be broken mid word if a single word is longer than the page. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Edit Mode |parName=editmode |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=13 |parSummary=Controls whether the text can be editing directly in the viewer. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=editmode |itemLabel=Locked |itemName=locked |itemSummary=The text is read only and cannot be edited in the viewer. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=editmode |itemLabel=Editable |itemName=editable |itemSummary=Clicking in an active viewer will begin edit mode, allowing the text to be edited directly in the viewer. When the viewer loses focus, by clicking outside or hitting enter or escape, the contents of the viewer will be saved back to Text parameter. If the Text parameter contains a bind expression, the text will be saved back to the member on the other side of the bind i.e. another parameter, DAT cell or python attribute. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=editmode |itemLabel=Select Only |itemName=selectonly |itemSummary=The text in the viewer can be selected and copied, but cannot be changed. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=editmode |itemLabel=Editable (Continuous Update) |itemName=editablecontinuous |itemSummary=Similar to the 'Editable' option, but the value is saved back to the source after every key stroke rather than just after the viewer loses focus. }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Shift-Enter for New Line |parName=shiftenter |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=14 |parSummary=In multiline mode, when this option is enabled, pressing Enter will complete editing and save the value and users must hold Shift and Enter if they wish to create a new line. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Reading Direction |parName=readingdirection |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=15 |parSummary=Use this parameter to control whether the text is displayed from left-to-right (LTR) or from right-to-left (RTL). Bidirectional layout is also supported when LTR characters are detected when using RTL mode. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=readingdirection |itemLabel=Left To Right |itemName=lefttoright |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=readingdirection |itemLabel=Right To Left |itemName=righttoleft |itemSummary= }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Drag Drop Behaviour |parName=dragdropmode |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=15 |parSummary=This parameter controls what happens when a user drags something onto an active panel. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=dragdropmode |itemLabel=Use Panel System |itemName=panel |itemSummary=Use the standard drag/drop controls. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=dragdropmode |itemLabel=Replace Text |itemName=textreplace |itemSummary=Automatically replace the text with text contents of the object being dragged. For example, if a node is dragged onto the viewer, the text will be replaced with the path for that node. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=dragdropmode |itemLabel=Append Text |itemName=textappend |itemSummary=Automatically append the text contents of the object being dragged onto the current contents of the view. For example, if a node is dragged onto the viewer, the path of that node will be added to the end of the current text. }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Focus Order |parName=fieldfocus |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parOrder=16 |parSummary=A path to a Table DAT containing a list of component paths that is used to control which panel receives the focus when a user hits TAB or Shift+Tab during editing. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Drag Drop Behavior |parName=dragdropmode |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=17 |parSummary=This parameter controls what happens when a user drags something onto an active panel. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=dragdropmode |itemLabel=Use Panel System |itemName=panel |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=dragdropmode |itemLabel=Insert Text |itemName=textinsert |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=dragdropmode |itemLabel=Replace Text |itemName=textreplace |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=dragdropmode |itemLabel=Append Text |itemName=textappend |itemSummary= }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parName=callbacks |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parOrder=18 |parSummary=The path of a Text DAT containing python callback functions that can be used to react to different events in the viewer. |parItems= }} }} {{ParameterPage |opFamily=COMP |pageName=Font |pageSummary= |items={{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=textCOMP |parLabel=Legacy Font Selection |parName=legacyfontselection |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=0 |parSummary=Enable to select the font using the legacy system of bold and italic toggles. But the text may extend any distance from the right edge depending on the length of the text. However, if word wrap is enabled in multiline mode, then the text will be wrapped at a distance from the right edge based on the padding. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=textpadding |itemLabel=Padding |itemName=textpaddingl |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=textpadding |itemLabel=Padding |itemName=textpaddingr |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=textpadding |itemLabel=Padding |itemName=textpaddingb |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=COMP |parName=textpadding |itemLabel=Padding |itemName=textpaddingt |itemSummary= }} }} }} [[Category:OP Help Common Pages]][[Category:OP Help Common Pages]]{{:COMP Layout Page}} [[Category:OP Help Common Pages]][[Category:OP Help Common Pages]]{{:COMP Panel Page}} [[Category:OP Help Common Pages]][[Category:OP Help Common Pages]]{{:COMP Look Page}} [[Category:OP Help Common Pages]][[Category:OP Help Common Pages]]{{:COMP Children Page}} [[Category:OP Help Common Pages]][[Category:OP Help Common Pages]]{{:COMP Drag Page}} [[Category:OP Help Common Pages]][[Category:OP Help Common Pages]]{{:COMP Extensions Page}} [[Category:OP Help Common Pages]][[Category:OP Help Common Pages]]{{:COMP Generator Common Page}} {{SeeAlso |opFamily= |items= }} {{History }} {{NavBox |Category=COMPs }} {{#invoke:Category|list|COMPs}}

{{Summary |opFilter=False |opLabel=Time |opFamily=COMP |long=The Time Component allows each component to have its own timeline (clock). The Time Component contains a network of operators that can drive a [[Timeline]], drive animations in [[Animation COMP]]s, or be used to drive any custom time-based system. The Time Component's parameters define the speed, range, various options for the time system. The Time Component is often used in TouchDesigner to allow a component to have its own timeline / clock, this is called [[Component Time]]. It is useful for holding some parts of your system stationary while others are allowed to play forward. A Time Component's location must be in the /local network of a [[Component]] for the Time Component to create a '''Component Time'''. To add Component Time to a component, right-click on the component and select '''Add Component Time...''' from the popup menu, this will add the following Time Component /''comppath''/local/time. The Time Component's predefined network is [[Clone|Cloned]] from Master Component /sys/local/time. The Time Component's network can be modified if the path in the Clone parameter is removed. |opClass=timeCOMP_Class |short=The Time Component allows each component to have its own timeline (clock). |opType=time |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |pageName=Time |pageSummary= |opFamily=COMP |items= {{Parameter|parName=play |parLabel=Play |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Controls the playback of the Time Component. 0 = stop, 1 = play. |parOrder=0 |opType=time |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=rate |parLabel=Rate |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Sets the frame per second for the Time Component. |parOrder=1 |opType=time |parType=Float |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=start |parLabel=Start |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Sets the start frame for the Time Component. The '''Start''' and '''End''' parameters determine the overall length of the Time Component. |parOrder=2 |opType=time |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=end |parLabel=End |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Sets the end frame for the Time Component. The '''Start''' and '''End''' parameters determine the overall length of the Time Component. |parOrder=3 |opType=time |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=rangelimit |parLabel=Range Limit |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=This menu controls how the playback loops: |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Loop |itemSummary=The timeline will loop when it reaches Range End frame. |itemName=loop |opFamily=COMP |parName=rangelimit }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Hold |itemSummary=The timeline will stop (hold) when it reaches Range End frame. |itemName=hold |opFamily=COMP |parName=rangelimit }} |parOrder=4 |opType=time |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parName=rangestart |parLabel=Range Start |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Sets the start frame of the working range. The working range is a subset of the start/end range which can be used to focus work on a smaller section of time. The playhead will only playback the frames/beats that are inside this working range. |parOrder=5 |opType=time |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=rangeend |parLabel=Range End |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Sets the end frame of the working range. The working range is a subset of the start/end range which can be used to focus work on a smaller section of time. The playhead will only playback the frames/beats that are inside this working range. |parOrder=6 |opType=time |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=resetframe |parLabel=Reset Frame |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Place holder to specify which frame to jump to (Obsolete). |parOrder=7 |opType=time |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems=}} {{Parameter|parName=signature |parLabel=Signature |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Specifies the time signature. The first number is the number of beats per measure and the second number indicates the type of note that constitutes one beat. See [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_signature Time Signature - Wikipedia] for additional information. |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel="" |itemSummary= |itemName=signature1 |opFamily=COMP |parName=signature }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel="" |itemSummary= |itemName=signature2 |opFamily=COMP |parName=signature }} |parOrder=8 |opType=time |parType=Int |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parName=tempo |parLabel=Tempo |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Sets the bpm for the Time Component. |parOrder=9 |opType=time |parType=Float |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=independent |parLabel=Run Independently |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=When checked on, this Time COMP's time will not be dependant on parent Time Components found in the network hierarchy. For example, starting/pausing other Time COMP's higher in the hierarchy will not start/pause a Time COMP whose '''Run Independently''' parameter is on. |parOrder=10 |opType=time |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} }} {{:COMP Extensions Page}} {{:COMP Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=COMP |opLabel=Time |infoChannels={{InfoChannel |chanName=fps |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=start |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=end |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=rstart |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=rend |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=bpm |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=sig1 |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=sig2 |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=play |chanSummary=}}}} {{History }} {{COMPNavBox |opFamily=COMP }} {{#invoke:Category |list|COMPs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=COMP |opType=usdCOMP |opLabel=USD |opClass=usdCOMP_Class |opFilter=True |opLicense=Non-Commercial |short=The USD COMP loads and imports most geometric schemas from a [[USD]] file in crate/binary or ASCII file formats with extensions as (.usd), (.usda), (.usdc), and (.usdz). Currently the USD version 20.08 is being used in USD COMP. |long=The USD COMP loads and imports most geometric schemas from a [[USD]] file in crate/binary or ASCII file formats with extensions as (.usd), (.usda), (.usdc), and (.usdz). Currently the USD version 0.18.9 is being used in USD COMP. You can drag-drop a USD file into a TouchDesigner network, or import it via the USD File parameter. See also [[File Types]]. The assets from the USD file are saved into a ".tdc" file with the same name as the USD file inside the TDImportCache folder, which is created next to your toe file. Assets are read from the ".tdc" file using Import Select OPs ([[Import Select TOP]] / [[Import Select SOP]] / [[Import Select CHOP]]). Upon reloading a .toe file, the assets can be imported directly from the ".tdc" cache, and the USD file will not need to be re-imported. However, if there is no existing ".tdc" (for instance, if the toe file changed computers) then the USD file will be reopened to grab the assets and a new ".tdc" will be saved out. To open a USD file in an USD COMP: 1) Specify a valid file path in the "USD File" parameter, including the name of the file with correct .usd extension. 2) This step is varied depending on whether the USD COMP is just created and if any changes in the default values of parameters are required or not. If the file is being loaded for the first time in the network and the default parameter values are accepted then simply press the "Build Network" to generate the USD network and import the assets. Note that we recommend toggling the "Merge Geometry" for any medium or large files as it can significantly improve performance. Generally, any changes in the parameters above the "Build Network" requires the network to be built again. 3) The "Reload" button is being used for reloading the internal assets (e.g. meshes, points, etc.) and this is specifically useful if the file has moved to another location and when the .toe file is opened the assets were not found and reloaded properly. 4) The "Update" button is used when some changes on USD file are made and we want to merge those changes into the current network without fully rebuilding it. Here are some examples: https://developer.apple.com/augmented-reality/quick-look/ See also: [[USD]], [[USD In TouchDesigner]], [[Import Select CHOP]], [[Import Select TOP]], [[Import Select SOP]], [[FBX COMP]] |opCategories= }}{{ParameterPage |opFamily=COMP |pageName=USD |pageSummary= |items={{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=usdCOMP |parLabel=USD File |parName=file |parType=filepath load |parReadOnly=False |parOrder=0 |parSummary=The path to the USD file. By default, this parameter is disabled and can be enabled once the toggle for Merge Geometry is set to ON. |parItems=}} {{Parameter |opFamily=COMP |opType=usdCOMP |parLabel=Max Wired Children |parName=maxwiredchildren |parType=integer |parReadOnly=False |parOrder=6 |parSummary=This value is used to define how many wired children a Geometry/Null COMP node can have on the same network level (note that this network level refers to all the nodes that can be seen on the same canvas network). {{Summary |opFilter=False |opLabel=Window |opFamily=COMP |long=The Window Component allows you to create and maintain a separate floating or fixed window displaying the contents of any [[Panel]] or any [[Node Viewer]]. Most frequently you are setting up the Window COMP /perform in the default TouchDesigner project. /perform is the default window for [[Perform Mode]]. In the Parameter dialog of the Window component you adjust its settings such as resolution, centering, and which monitor(s) the window will get displayed on. You then press F1 to go into [[Perform Mode]] and operate/display the panel standalone. Press Esc over a window to close it and go back to [[Designer Mode]]. You can create more Window Components, point them to panels or other Operators like TOPs, adjust their parameters and then pulse the parameter Open as Separate Window to see its effect. Use the Dialog-> [[Window Placement Dialog]] which controls which window COMPs get displayed on startup. All Window COMPS in your project are listed there and you can test them individually. A window can be fit to a single monitor, or span several monitors. Attach an [[Info CHOP]] to the Window component - it will show you the window's current location and size, and whether the window is actually open. See also [[Window]], [[Multiple Monitors]]. |opClass=windowCOMP_Class |short=The Window Component allows you to create and maintain a separate floating window displaying the contents of any [[Panel]] or any other [[Node Viewer]]. |opType=window |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |pageName=Window |pageSummary= |opFamily=COMP |items= {{Parameter|parName=winop |parLabel=Window Operator |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Specifies the operator the window will display. |parOrder=0 |opType=window |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=title |parLabel=Title |opFamily=COMP |parSummary= Specify the window's title. |parOrder=1 |opType=window |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} ---- {{Parameter|parName=justifyoffsetto |parLabel=Justisy and Offset to... |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=All the positioning parameters below are done relative to the location you specify here. Enabled means it will update in sync with the monitors refresh which avoids tearing and lost frames. Disabled means it can update at any point during the refresh which can result in tearing or lost frames. FPS is Half Monitor Rate should be used when doing things such as running a 30fps file on a 60Hz display. This makes each update be shown for exactly 2 refreshes which keeps motion looking smooth. |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Disabled |itemSummary=Vertical Sync off. |itemName=disabled |opFamily=COMP |parName=vsyncmode }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Enabled |itemSummary=Vertical Sync on. |itemName=enabled |opFamily=COMP |parName=vsyncmode }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=FPS is Half Monitor Rate |itemSummary=This allows you to run your project at 30FPS on a 60Hz monitor, but ensuring every image is shown for exactly 2 refreshes. Without this option an image may be shown for 1 or 3 refreshes, which makes the content look like it is stuttering. Currently this feature is not functional in the 2022.20000+ series of builds, but we hope to bring back this feature when Vulkan adds support for it. |itemName=halfmonitorrate |opFamily=COMP |parName=vsyncmode }} |parOrder=19 |opType=window |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parName=drawwindow |parLabel=Draw Window |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=When disabled the window will not update it's contents at all. Useful for processes that arn't doing rendering such as Audio or networking processes, or for when using VR devices. |parOrder=20 |opType=window |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=hwframelock |parLabel=Hardware Frame-Lock |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Provides multi-GPU frame-lock sync using [https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/design-visualization/solutions/quadro-sync/ Nvidia Quadro Sync] and [http://www.amd.com/us/products/workstation/graphics/s400/Pages/s400.aspx AMD S400] sync cards. '''Note: Not currently supported on the 2022.20000 and later series of builds, since this feature is not yet available for Vulkan'''. For more information, see [[Syncing Multiple Computers]] and [[Hardware Frame Lock]]. |parOrder=21 |opType=window |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=openglstereo |parLabel=OpenGL Stereo |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Turn 'On' when using openGL stereoscopic output. |parOrder=22 |opType=window |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems=}} {{Parameter|parName=winrightop |parLabel=Right Eye Operator |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=This parameter is enabled when the OpenGL Stereo parameter above is turned on. Specify the [[Camera COMP]] used for the right eye here. |parOrder=23 |opType=window |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems=}} ---- {{Parameter|parName=performance |parLabel=Open as Perform Window |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Opens this Window COMP in [[Perform Mode]]. Any Window COMP can be set as default Perform Window (opens using F1 shortcut) using the [[Window Placement Dialog]]. This button allows you to open this Window COMP in Perform Mode without changing what is currently selected as the 'default' Perform Window. |parOrder=24 |opType=window |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=winopen |parLabel=Open as Separate Window |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Opens this Window COMP as its own floating window, not as the Perform Window. Useful for things such as dialog boxes, popups, or testing, but should not be used for putting final rendered content to outputs. Use a single large Perform Window for that instead of separate windows. |parOrder=25 |opType=window |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=winclose |parLabel=Close |opFamily=COMP |parSummary= Closes the window, if it's open. |parOrder=26 |opType=window |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=setperform |parLabel=Set as Perform Window |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=Permanently changes the Perform Window setting in the Window Placement dialog to this window. |parOrder=27 |opType=window |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=opendialog |parLabel=Window Placement Dialog |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=A shortcut to open the Window Placement dialog. |parOrder=28 |opType=window |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=includedialog |parLabel=Include in Placement Dialog |opFamily=COMP |parSummary=When 'On' this Window COMP will be displayed in the Window Placement Dialog. |parOrder=28 |opType=window |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} }} {{:COMP Extensions Page}} {{:COMP Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=COMP |opLabel=Window |infoChannels={{InfoChannel |chanName=winx |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=winy |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=winw |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=winh |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=winopen |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=fill |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=borders |chanSummary=}}}} {{History }} {{COMPNavBox |opFamily=COMP }} {{#invoke:Category |list|COMPs}}

'''UPDATE:''' At 13:00 into this vid the tutorial shows exporting from a CHOP to a TOP parameter using the CHOP Exporter in 077.  In more recent versions of TouchDesigner, the CHOP Exporter has been removed. To export the the CHOP channel follow these instructions.

# Turn on the '''Viewer Active''' flag on the CHOP ''null1''.
# Drag the ''chan1'' channel from the CHOP viewer and drop it on the first '''Scale''' parameter (sx) of the ''transform3'' TOP.
# Select '''Export CHOP''' from the pop-up dialog.

Refer to [[CHOP Export]] for additional help exporting CHOP channels in more recent versions of TouchDesigner.

See also [[Introduction to TOPs Vid Notes]].

{{Summary
	|opFamily=TOP
	|opType=kinectazureTOP
	|opLabel=Kinect Azure
	|opClass=kinectazureTOP_Class
	|opFilter=False
	|opLicense=Non-Commercial
    |os=Microsoft Windows 10 April 2018 or newer
    |hardware=An NVIDIA GEFORCE GTX 1070 or better graphics card is required to obtain efficient body tracking data from the camera, although a CPU-only mode can be enabled using the parameters.
	|short=The Kinect Azure TOP can be used to configure and capture data from a Microsoft Kinect Azure camera.
	|long=The Kinect Azure TOP can be used to configure and capture data from a Microsoft Kinect Azure camera. 
    
The TOP can be used to configure the settings of the camera (resolution, frame rate, synchronization, etc) as well to retrieve captured images from either its color or depth cameras. Image data from one camera can be remapped (aligned) to the other camera in order to match color and depth information. Only one Kinect Azure TOP can be connected to a single Kinect camera. To retrieve additional images from the same camera, use a [[Kinect Azure Select TOP]].
    
The Kinect Azure can also extract body tracking information and skeleton positions using the depth camera image. To access this data, use a [[Kinect Azure CHOP]] and set its Kinect TOP parameter to the primary [[Kinect Azure TOP]] that is connected to the device.

'''TIP:''' See Elburz' video on using KinectAzure's point clouds and a bunch of Azure general tips. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P_PjAr2Yzao Kinect Azure Point Cloud in TouchDesigner Tutorial] on the Interactive and Immersive HQ.

See also [[Kinect Azure CHOP]], [[Kinect Azure Select TOP]], [[Palette:pointRender]], [[Palette:kinectCalibration]], [[Palette:kinectRecorder]], [[Palette:kinectPointcloud]].
	|opCategories=
	}}

{{Summary
	|opFamily=TOP
	|opType=kinectazureTOP
	|opLabel=Kinect Azure
	|opClass=kinectazureTOP_Class
	|opFilter=False
	|opLicense=TouchDesigner Non-Commercial
	|os=Microsoft Windows 10 April 2018 or newer
    
	|hardware=An NVIDIA GEFORCE GTX 1070 or better graphics card is required to obtain efficient body tracking data from the camera, although a CPU-only mode can be enabled using the parameters.
	|short=The Kinect Azure TOP can be used to configure and capture data from a Microsoft Kinect Azure camera.
	|long=The Kinect Azure TOP can be used to configure and capture data from a Microsoft Kinect Azure camera. 
    
The TOP can be used to configure the settings of the camera (resolution, frame rate, synchronization, etc) as well to retrieve captured images from either its color or depth cameras. Image data from one camera can be remapped (aligned) to the other camera in order to match color and depth information. Only one Kinect Azure TOP can be connected to a single Kinect camera. To retrieve additional images from the same camera, use a [[Kinect Azure Select TOP]].
    
The Kinect Azure can also extract body tracking information and skeleton positions using the depth camera image. To access this data, use a [[Kinect Azure CHOP]] and set its Kinect TOP parameter to the primary [[Kinect Azure TOP]] that is connected to the device.

'''TIP:''' See Elburz' video on using KinectAzure's point clouds and a bunch of Azure general tips. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P_PjAr2Yzao Kinect Azure Point Cloud in TouchDesigner Tutorial] on the Interactive and Immersive HQ.

See also [[Kinect Azure CHOP]], [[Kinect Azure Select TOP]], [[Palette:pointRender]], [[Palette:kinectCalibration]], [[Palette:kinectRecorder]], [[Palette:kinectPointcloud]].
	|opCategories=
	}}

{{Parameter
	|opFamily=TOP
	|opType=kinectazureTOP
	|parLabel=Image
	|parName=image
	|parType=Menu
	|parReadOnly=
	|parOrder=9
	|parSummary=A list of available image types to capture from the device and display in this TOP. All image types have a second version that is mapped (aligned) to the image space of the other camera so that color and depth image data can be matched. The resolution of the image is controlled by the Color Resolution or Depth Mode parameters depending on the type of image selected. Use a [[Kinect Azure Select TOP]] to access additional image types from the same camera.
	|parItems={{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=Color
	|itemName=color
	|itemSummary=An 8-bit RGBA image from the color camera.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=Color aligned to Depth
	|itemName=colorremap
	|itemSummary=The color camera image remapped to align with the current depth camera image. The resolution is determined by the Depth Mode.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=Depth
	|itemName=depth
	|itemSummary=A single channel 32bit floating point depth image where pixel values measure the distance in meters from the camera. Resolution and field of view are determined by the Depth Mode parameter.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=Depth aligned to Color
	|itemName=depthremap
	|itemSummary=The depth image remapped to align with the current color camera image. The resolution is determined by the Color Resolution parameter.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=IR
	|itemName=ir
	|itemSummary=A 16-bit integer infrared image captured by the depth camera. Resolution and field of view are determined by the Depth Mode.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=IR aligned to Color
	|itemName=irremap
	|itemSummary=The infrared image remapped to align the current color camera image. The resolution is determined by the Color Resolution parameter.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=Player Index
	|itemName=playerindex
	|itemSummary=An 8-bit single channel image that maps pixels to players that have been identified by the body tracking system. Pixel values represent the body id multiplied by 25 to improve contrast. Note: The player index map may have additional hardware requirements (CUDA capable graphics card) and may not synchronize with the color or depth images depending on current settings. The resolution is determined by the current Depth Mode.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=Player Index aligned to Color
	|itemName=playerindexremap
	|itemSummary=The player index map remapped to align with the current color image. The resolution is determined by the Color Resolution parameter.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=Point Cloud
	|itemName=pointcloud
	|itemSummary=A 32bit floating point RGBA image where the depth information has been converted into XYZ positions that are stored in the RGB channels. Position data is represented in meters and the resolution and field of view are determined by the Depth Mode. The Point Cloud image can be viewed in 3D by activating the TOP and selecting 'View as Points' in the right-click menu, or by using the TOP as an instance source in the Geometry COMP.
	}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem
	|opFamily=TOP
	|parName=image
	|itemLabel=Point Cloud aligned to Color
	|itemName=pointcloudremap
	|itemSummary=The point cloud image remapped to align with the current color image. Note: Remapping the image can create gaps and artifacts when view the points in 3D.
	}}
	}}
{{Parameter
	|opFamily=TOP
	|opType=kinectazureTOP
	|parLabel=Align Image to Other Camera
	|parName=remapimage
	|parType=Toggle
	|parReadOnly=
	|parOrder=10
	|parSummary=When enabled, the current image will be remapped to align with images from the other camera. For example, use this feature to create a color camera image that maps to the pixels of the depth camera.
The current depth mode and color resolution will be used to do the remapping.
Note: Remapping the point cloud image can create artifacts in the distribution of points due to gaps in the remapping algorithm.
	|parItems=
	}}
{{Parameter
	|opFamily=TOP
	|opType=kinectazureTOP
	|parLabel=Sync Image to Body Tracking
	|parName=bodyimage
	|parType=Toggle
	|parReadOnly=
	|parOrder=11
	|parSummary=When enabled, the image produced will be delayed so that it corresponds to the most recent data in the body tracking system. The amount of delay may fluctuate based on the power of the processor doing the body tracking and the complexity of the scene. A [[Kinect Azure Select TOP]] can be used at the same time to retrieve the real-time image stream.
	|parItems=
	}}
{{Parameter
	|opFamily=TOP
	|opType=kinectazureTOP
	|parLabel=Mirror Image
	|parName=mirrorimage
	|parType=Toggle
	|parReadOnly=
	|parOrder=12
	|parSummary=Flip the image in the horizontal axis.
	|parItems=
	}}
{{Parameter
	|opFamily=TOP
	|opType=kinectazureTOP
	|parLabel=CPU Body Tracking
	|parName=cpu
	|parType=Toggle

	|parOrder=9999
	|parSummary=When enabled, body tracking calculations will be done on the CPU rather than on the graphics card. This method is much slower, but does not require a high-powered graphics card to function.
	|parItems=
	}}
