{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=Insert |long=The Insert DAT allows you to insert a row or column into an existing table. You can add strings that will be put in the new cells, space separated. If you want a cell to include spaces, in the Contents parameter put the cell contents in quotes: cell1 'cell 2' cell3. Or a list in the parameter expression: ['cell1', 'cell 2'] If the input DAT is not a table, it will be converted to a table. |opType=insert |opClass=insertDAT_Class |opFilter=True |short=The Insert DAT allows you to insert a row or column into an exiting table. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=insert |parOrder=0 |parLabel=Insert |opType=insert |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=insert |itemLabel=Row |itemSummary=Insert a row. |itemName=row }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=insert |itemLabel=Column |itemSummary=Insert a column. |itemName=col }} |parSummary=Specify what to insert. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=at |parOrder=1 |parLabel=At |opType=insert |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=at |itemLabel=Before First |itemSummary=Insert at the beginning. |itemName=start }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=at |itemLabel=After Last |itemSummary=Append to the end. |itemName=end }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=at |itemLabel=Index |itemSummary=Insert at the specified index. |itemName=index }} |parSummary=Specify where to insert. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=index |parLabel=Index |parOrder=2 |opType=insert |parSummary=Index to insert the row or column. You can use local variables $NR and $NC to append at the end of the table. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=contents |parLabel=Contents |parOrder=3 |opType=insert |parSummary=Entries for each cell separated by spaces. Put entries that have spaces in quotes, for example Name Species "Home Planet" will put Name in the first cell, Species in the second, and Home Planet in the third. Extra entries will be ignored. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Insert |pageSummary= }} {{:DAT Filter Common Page }} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary= }} }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Insert |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opType=jsonDAT |opLabel=JSON |opClass=jsonDAT_Class |opFilter=True |opLicense=Non-Commercial |short=The JSON DAT converts and filters JSON text using [[JSONPath]] syntax and outputs the filtered results. It eliminates having to code scripts to parse and manipulate JSON, and keeps the data flow procedural. |long=The JSON DAT converts and filters JSON text using [[JSONPath]] syntax and outputs the filtered results. It eliminates having to code scripts to parse and manipulate JSON, and keeps the data flow procedural. It expects JSON text as input and converts the input to a Python object in the DAT.source member. It then filters the JSON down using the [[JSONPath|JSONPath Filter parameter]], and it outputs the resulting data from the DAT as JSON text. It also puts the filtered results as DAT.results (a Python list of results) and DAT.result (the first result). You can test expressions on DAT.source, DAT.result and DAT.results by setting the Output menu to Expression and using expressions like me.result['city'], which outputs the evaluated expression from the DAT. You can then use that expression as op('json1').result['city'] in an expression elsewhere. DAT.expr is also a member of the JSON DAT, for example, op('json1').expr returns the evaluated expression parameter. '''Output tables''': The JSON DAT can output a table by setting the Output Format menu to Table. It will do its best to take the result of the JSON Filter and form rows and columns of values and headings in a DAT table. Any cell than can't be expressed as a simple string, integer, float or boolean will be left as the JSON string of the remainder. A cell or range of cells can be further reduced with a [[Select DAT]] and then passed to another JSON DAT which can convert the JSON strings to a table. '''See also:''' [[JSONPath]], [[OP Snippets]], and the [[TDJSON]] functions for converting and manipulating JSON data. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |opFamily=DAT |pageName=JSON |pageSummary= |items={{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=jsonDAT |parLabel=Filter |parName=filter |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parOrder=0 |parSummary=A filter string following JSONPath syntax that will be used to filter the input JSON. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=jsonDAT |parLabel=Output |parName=output |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= |parOrder=1 |parSummary=Select the output of the JSON DAT. |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=DAT |parName=output |itemLabel=Filter Result |itemName=filterresult |itemSummary=Outputs list returned from applying the filter to the JSON text input. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=DAT |parName=output |itemLabel=Expression |itemName=expression |itemSummary=Output a custom expression. }} }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=jsonDAT |parLabel=Expression |parName=expression |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parOrder=2 |parSummary=The custom expression to output |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=jsonDAT |parLabel=Format Output |parName=formatoutput |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=3 |parSummary=When enabled, the output of the DAT will formatted with indents and newlines. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=jsonDAT |parLabel=Hold Last Non-Empty Results |parName=holdlast |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=4 |parSummary=When enabled, the most recent result will be held if the results become empty, in effect only new non-empty results will update the output. |parItems= }} }} {{:DAT Filter Common Page}} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary=A JSON text input. }} }} {{SeeAlso |opFamily= |items= }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=JSON |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{NavBox |Category=DATs }} {{#invoke:Category|list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=Keyboard In |long=The Keyboard In DAT lists the most recent key events in its FIFO (first in/first out) table. There is one row for every key press down and every key-up, including Shift, Ctrl and Alt, with distinction between left and right side. For convenience, with each key press, a column indicates if the Shift, Ctrl and Alt were being held down at the time. You get key presses even of the cursor is outside the TouchDesigner windows, whether they are control panels, Perform Mode or the network editor window. Exceptions: while entering text in the editor window. You can set a filter to watch only certain keys. Custom shortcuts can be defined and handled by a [[keyboardinDAT_Class|python callback in the attached script]]. |opType=keyboardin |opClass=keyboardinDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The Keyboard In DAT lists the most recent key events in its FIFO (first in/first out) table. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=0 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=Inhibits and allows message to be added to log. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=perform |parLabel=Perform Window Only |parOrder=1 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=When on, key events are only detected while in perform mode. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=keys |parLabel=Keys |parOrder=2 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=List of keys to allow through the filter. Just put the characters in the list, space-separated. Eg. '1 2 g h' for the 1, 2, g and h keys. Only these keys will be added to the log and generate an event. If blank, no filtering will be done. List of accepted keys: [[Keyboard UI]] |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=shortcuts |parLabel=Shortcuts |parOrder=3 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=List of shortcuts to watch for. See "Shortcuts" in the notes for defining shortcuts. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=panels |parLabel=Panels |parOrder=4 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=Optional list of references to panels to detect events from. Events will only be fired when any of the listed panels has focus. |parType=PanelCOMP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=lrmodifiers |parLabel=Left/Right Modifiers |parOrder=5 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=When on, the states of the left and right modifier keys (see Notes) will be added to the table. Switching the state of this parameter will reset the table's contents. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Keyboard In |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=callbacks |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parOrder=0 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=Path to a DAT containing callbacks for each keyboard event received. See keyboardinDAT_Class for usage. |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=keyboardin |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the current node location (for example, where 'cc' points to). |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Callbacks DAT |itemSummary= |itemName=callbacks }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=The operator whose state change will trigger the DAT to execute its script when Execute is set to Specified Operator. This operator is also the path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to Specified Operator. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clamp |parLabel=Clamp Output |parOrder=3 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=The DAT is limited to 100 messages by default but with Clamp Output, this can be set to anything including unlimited. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=maxlines |parLabel=Maximum Lines |parOrder=4 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=Limits the number of messages, older messages are removed from the list first. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clear |parLabel=Clear Output |parOrder=5 |opType=keyboardin |parSummary=Deletes all lines except the heading. To clear with a python script op(''"opname"'').par.clear.pulse() |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Log |pageSummary= }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{OPSection |sectionName=Notes |sectionSummary='''Shortcuts''' are defined by a list of modifier keys (see below) and a "trigger" key separated by .'s. For example, ctrl.shift.a the modifier keys are ctrl and shift, and the trigger key is a. This shortcut will be activated when one of the ctrl and shift keys are pressed and the trigger key, a is pressed down. If any other modifier keys are pressed, the shortcut will not be detected. Modifier Keys - The following are all the valid modifier keys: *lalt - Left alt key. *ralt - Right alt key. *alt - Either left or right alt key. *lctrl - Left ctrl key. *rctrl - Right ctrl key. *ctrl - Either left or right ctrl key. *lshift - Left shift key. *rshift - Right shift key. *shift - Either left or right shift key. |opFamily=DAT}} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary= }} }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Keyboard In |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary
	|opFamily=DAT
	|opType=lookupDAT
	|opLabel=Lookup
	|opClass=lookupDAT_Class
	|opFilter=True
	|opLicense=Non-Commercial
	|short=The Lookup DAT  outputs values from a lookup Table. The first input is an index into the second input.
	|long=The Lookup DAT  outputs values from a lookup Table. The first input is an index into the second input. 
    
The Lookup DAT allows you to select rows from its second input by referencing data either via row/column indices or row/column names. The advantage of the Lookup DAT is such that the order the data is selected is independent from the order in the Lookup Table, rather the Index Table dictates the order therefore allowing for reordering of data and selecting rows/columns multiple times.

{{Summary					
	|opFamily=DAT				
	|opLicense=Non-Commercial				
	|opLabel=Merge				
	|long=The Merged DAT is a multi-input DAT which merges the text or tables from the input DATs together.				
	|opType=merge				
	|opClass=mergeDAT_Class				
	|opFilter=True				
	|short=The Merged DAT is a multi-input DAT which merges the text or tables from the input DATs together.				
|opCategories=				
	}}					
{{ParameterPage					
	|items=				
	{{Parameter|opFamily=DAT			
		|parName=dat			
		|parLabel=DAT			
		|parOrder=0			
		|opType=merge			
		|parSummary=Specifies the path to DATs to be merged. Can be used in conjunction with the operator's wired inputs.			
	|parType=DAT
	|parReadOnly=			
		|parItems=			
		}}				
	{{Parameter|opFamily=DAT			
		|parName=how			
		|parOrder=1			
		|parLabel=How			
		|opType=merge			
		|parItems=			
		{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT		
			|parName=how		
			|itemLabel=Append Rows		
			|itemSummary=Merges tables together by adding rows from subsequent tables to the first table. If the By Name option is used, then data from subsequent tables will be added to the column with the same name, and the first row will not be added. If the subsequent tables have more columns than the input table, they will be appended.		
			|itemName=row		
		}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT		
			|parName=how		
			|itemLabel=Append Columns		
			|itemSummary=Merges tables together by adding columns from subsequent tables to the first table. If the By Name option is used, then data from subsequent tables will be added to the row with the same name, and the first column will not be added. If the subsequent tables have more rows than the input table, they will be appended.		
			|itemName=col		
		}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT		
			|parName=how		
			|itemLabel=Collapse Columns		
			|itemSummary=Merges tables together by concatenating all cells in a row into one single cell. You will have one column and one or more rows at the end.		
			|itemName=collapsecol		
		}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT		
			|parName=how		
			|itemLabel=Collapse Rows		
			|itemSummary=Merges tables together by concatenating all cells in a column into one single cell. You will have one row and one or more columns at the end.		
			|itemName=collapserow		
		}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT		
			|parName=how		
			|itemLabel=Collapse Cells		
			|itemSummary=Merges tables together by concatenating all cells together. You will have one single cell at the end.		
			|itemName=collapsecells		
		}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT		
			|parName=how		
			|itemLabel=Replace Cells by Column		
			|itemSummary=Replaces data in the first table with data in subsequent tables, matching by row names. Data from the last table will always be used.		
			|itemName=repcolcells		
		}}<!--
-->{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT		
			|parName=how		
			|itemLabel=Replace Cells by Row		
			|itemSummary=Replaces data in the first table with data in subsequent tables, matching by column names. Data from the last table will always be used.<!--TDitemEnd-->		
					
: For example, if your first input table is 					
					
  Name          Species	  Age				
  Birch	        Ferret	  6			
  Diefenbaker	Ferret	  4			
					
: and you have two more input tables in the order					
					
  Name          Species	   Age				
  Birch	        Ferret	   5			
  Diefenbaker	Wolverine  5				
					
  Name          Species	  Age				
  Birch	        Ferret	   6			
  Diefenbaker	Otter	   10			
					
: your output table will be					
					
  Name          Species	  Age				
  Birch	        Ferret	   5			
			|itemName=reprowcells		
		}}			
					
		|parSummary=Sets how tables are merged together.			
	|parType=Menu

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=MIDI Event |long=The MIDI Event DAT logs all [[MIDI]] messages coming into or out of TouchDesigner from all MIDI In/Out operators. Note: no messages will be logged if there are no active MIDI In or Out operators set to receive them. It outputs columns in a table format: message, type, channel, index, value. The table is FIFO "first-in first-out" and limited to parameter-set number of lines. An optional script may be run for each packet received. See also the [[MIDI In DAT]], [[MIDI In Map CHOP]], [[MIDI In CHOP]], [[MIDI Out CHOP]], Tscript midi() Command. |opType=midievent |opClass=midieventDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The MIDI Event DAT logs all MIDI messages coming into TouchDesigner from all MIDI devices. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=0 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Logs MIDI events when turned on. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Connect |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=skipsense |parLabel=Skip Sense |parOrder=0 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Does not log sense messages when this is turned on. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=skiptiming |parLabel=Skip Timing |parOrder=1 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Does not report timing messages when this is turned on. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=filter |parLabel=Filter Messages |parOrder=2 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Turning this on enables the message filtering parameters below. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=message |parLabel=Message |parOrder=3 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Filter by the MIDI message content. Example "Control Change" |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=channel |parLabel=Channel |parOrder=4 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Filter by the MIDI message channel. Channels range from 1 to 16. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=index |parLabel=Index |parOrder=5 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Filter by the MIDI message index. Indices range from 1 to 128. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=value |parLabel=Value |parOrder=6 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Filter by the MIDI message value. Values range from 0 to 127. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=dir |parLabel=Dir |parOrder=7 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Filter by the message direction, "input" or "output". |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Filter |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=callbacks |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parOrder=0 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Runs this script once for each row added to the table (ie. MIDI event recieved). See [[midieventDAT_Class]] for usage. |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=midievent |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the current node location. |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Callbacks DAT |itemSummary=The script is executed from the location of the DAT specified in the Callbacks DAT parameter. |itemName=callbacks }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=midievent |parSummary=The operator whose state change will trigger the DAT to execute its script when Execute is set to Specified Operator. This operator is also the path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to Specified Operator. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clamp |parLabel=Clamp Output |parOrder=3 |opType=midievent |parSummary=The DAT is limited to 100 messages by default but with Clamp Output, this can be set to anything including unlimited. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=maxlines |parLabel=Maximum Lines |parOrder=4 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Limits the number of messages, older messages are removed from the list first. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clear |parLabel=Clear Output |parOrder=5 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Deletes all lines except the heading. To clear with a python script op(''"opname"'').par.clear.pulse() |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=bytes |parLabel=Bytes Column |parOrder=6 |opType=midievent |parSummary=Outputs the raw bytes of the message in a separate column. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Received Messages |pageSummary= }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=MIDI Event |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary			
	|opFamily=DAT		
	|opLicense=Non-Commercial		
	|opLabel=Monitors		
	|long=The Monitors DAT is a table of data about all currently detected monitors with information on the resolution, screen positioning, monitor name and description, GPU, and a flag indicating whether it is a primary monitor or not.		
			
You can also set it to display the overall bounds of all the detected monitors.			
			
It runs a callback script when a change in the monitors has been detected. These changes can be that a monitor was plugged in, a monitor was unplugged, the resolution of a monitor has changed, or the primary monitor has changed.			
			
The Monitor DAT returns top/bottom values in lower-left origin coordinates, (0,0) is the lower-left corner of the monitor.			
	|opType=monitors		
	|opClass=monitorsDAT_Class		
	|opFilter=False		
	|short=The Monitors DAT is a table of data about all currently detected monitors with information on the resolution, screen positioning, monitor name and description, GPU, and a flag indicating whether it is a primary monitor or not.		
|opCategories=		
	}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=MQTT Client |long=The MQTT Client DAT receives and sends data from/to [[MQTT]] devices via MQTT servers (broker). TouchDesigner can act as a client and another computer needs to act as a MQTT Server. Once a client establishes a connection with a server, it can do two things: # Send a message to the server to express interest in any data that has a specific "topic" string. This is called "subscribing". Then the MQTT Client DAT will receive all messages that the server gets with that topic. # Inform the server that it will send messages to the server with a certain topic string, and then send messages with that topic. The messages then get forward to any client that has expressed interest in that topic. See also [[MQTT]], [[TCP/IP DAT]]. |opType=mqttclient |opClass=mqttclientDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The MQTT Client DAT receives and sends data from/to [[MQTT]] devices via MQTT servers (broker). |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=0 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=Enable the connection. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=netaddress |parLabel=Network Address |parOrder=1 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=The address of the broker to connect to. The address should take the form ://:. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=specifyid |parLabel=Specify ID |parOrder=2 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=Allows naming the client with parameter User Client ID, otherwise automatically and uniquely generated for each connection. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=usercid |parLabel=User Client ID |parOrder=3 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=Client name when Specify ID enabled. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=keepalive |parLabel=Keep Alive Interval |parOrder=4 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=Specifies in seconds, the maximum time to expect without communication. If no data is sent during this time, a lightweight ping message is sent to the server instead. Can be set to 0 to avoid pings. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=maxinflight |parLabel=Max in Flight |parOrder=5 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary= Controls how many messages can be in-flight simultaneously. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=cleansession |parLabel=Clean Session |parOrder=6 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=If Specify ID is selected, the server will preserve any state information associated with the connection of that ID, such as subscriptions, delivery attempts, etc. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=verifycert |parLabel=Verify Certificate |parOrder=6 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=Enables TLS (transport layer security) certificate verification against the server (ie. broker). |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=username |parLabel=Username |parOrder=6 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=Specify the username for authentication if the server requires it. MQTT servers that support the MQTT v3.1 protocol provide authentication and authorization via username and password. |parType=String |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=password |parLabel=Password |parOrder=6 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=Specify the password for authentication if the server requires it. MQTT servers that support the MQTT v3.1 protocol provide authentication and authorization via username and password. |parType=String |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=reconnect |parLabel=Reconnect |parOrder=7 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=Will attempt to reconnect to the MQTT broker. |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Connect |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=callbacks |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parOrder=0 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary=The Callbacks DAT contains functions that are called when connections are made, lost or published data arrives. See [[mqttclientDAT_Class]] for usage. |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=mqttclient |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the current node location (for example, where 'cc' points to). |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Callbacks DAT |itemSummary=The script is executed from the location of the DAT specified in the Callbacks DAT parameter. |itemName=callbacks }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=mqttclient |parSummary= The operator whose state change will trigger the DAT to execute its script when Execute From is set to Specified Operator. {{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=Multi Touch In |long=The Multi Touch In DAT is used for receiving messages and events from the Windows 7+ standard multi-touch API. It captures all the messages, where each new message changes the table it outputs. When a messages is added to the DAT, any script can be called pointing to the new message. The Multi Touch In DAT is most frequently sent to the [[Render Pick DAT]]. It can output either of two table formats: (1) Raw Events as a FIFO (first in - first out) list, or (2) ID Table, which is the events processed into a more usable one-row-per-finger table. The Raw Events format creates a FIFO-type DAT (see also [[FIFO DAT]]) which, for each multi-touch event, has a row added to the bottom of the table while at the same time a row at the top is deleted. Note: To operate panel gadgets with multi-touch screens that send events through the Windows 7, 8 or 10 event stream, multi-touch works without requiring DATs. You need to use the DAT when using multiple fingers on one panel, like in a container displaying a 3D render whose objects you want to pick. The ID table format includes the columns: * id - every finger press increases the id by 1 * sn - an ongoing count of each finger press. * select - when 1, this row represents a finger is down. * downf - the absolute frame number when the finger press occurred. * upf - the absolute frame number that the finger press ended * x, y - the position, in pixels in the horizontal and vertical directions. NOTE: The x and y values are expressed in screen pixels, not panel width/height pixels. For example, the top-right corner of a panel will be different if the panel is scaled within another panel, window or network viewer. It is better to use u and v, and scale them by the panel Width and Height. * u, v - the position, 0 to 1 in the horizontal and vertical directions * downu, downv - the position, 0 to 1 in the horizontal and vertical directions when the touch first occured (ie. initial touch down location). contactx, contacty - the width of the contact area. contactu, contactv - the height of the contact area. ** monitor - monitor number, starting with 0 * clicktime - like downf, in seconds * elapsedtime - the number of seconds that finger has been down. * changedtime - the time since the finger press that the most recent u or v value changed. * dclick - double-tap occurred * aux - user supplied data via the [[PanelCOMP_Class]] method interactTouch(). When the event is triggered by the mouse via the Include Mouse option, aux will include the mouse buttons used (1 for left, 2 for middle, 4 for right, can be tested bitwise). You can use the attached callback DAT (named mtouchin1_callbacks) to react to multi-touch events. This is suitable for 2D interfaces that do not require a [[Render Pick DAT]]. See the [[Palette:multiTouch]] example in the [[Palette]] under Tools. See also the [[MultiTouch]] page. |opType=mtouchin |opClass=multitouchinDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The Multi Touch In DAT is used for receiving messages and events from the Windows 7+ standard multi-touch API. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=0 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=Registers event when Active is On. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=outputtype |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Output |opType=mtouchin |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=outputtype |itemLabel=Raw Events |itemSummary=Events are added to the table in a first in - first out (FIFO) order. |itemName=log }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=outputtype |itemLabel=ID Table |itemSummary=Events are processed using one-row-per-finger in the table. |itemName=changes }} |parSummary=Sets how the output is displayed in the table. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=panel |parLabel=Panel |parOrder=2 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=The [[Panel Component]] to capture the touch events from. |parType=PanelCOMP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=relativeid |parLabel=Relative IDs |parOrder=3 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=Reorder the touch ids so only the ones within the specified panel are counted. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=relativepos |parLabel=Relative Position |parOrder=4 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=Output position and normalized coordinates relative to lower left corner of the specified panel. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=mouse |parLabel=Include Mouse |parOrder=5 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=When on, the mouse add a touch event when clicked. This event always shares ID 1 with the first touch. Using mouse and multitouch at the same time may result in unexpected behaviours. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=posthresh |parLabel=Position Threshold |parOrder=6 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=A new message will not be added if a finger has moved less than this number of units. The units are determined by the input device, not necessarily the resolution of the screen that it is associated with. |parType=Float |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=contactthresh |parLabel=Contact Threshold |parOrder=7 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=Some touch devices have a width and height of a press, representing pressure of amount of finger contact. This is a minimum threshold below which no events are recognized. |parType=Float |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=minrows |parLabel=Min Rows Displayed |parOrder=8 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=The minimum number of rows always displayed in the table. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=doubleclickthresh |parLabel=Double Click (secs) |parOrder=9 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=The maximum time allowed between clicks to be registered as a 'double-click'. |parType=Float |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Multi Touch In |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=callbacks |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parOrder=0 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=Path to a DAT containing callbacks. |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=mtouchin |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the current node location (for example, where 'cc' points to). |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Callbacks DAT |itemSummary=The script is executed from the location of the Callbacks DAT specified above. |itemName=callbacks }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the component specified in the Component parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=The path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to ''Specified Operator''. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clamp |parLabel=Clamp Output |parOrder=3 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=The DAT is limited to 100 messages by default but with Clamp Output, this can be set to anything including unlimited. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=maxlines |parLabel=Maximum Lines |parOrder=4 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=Limits the number of messages, older messages are removed from the list first. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clear |parLabel=Clear Output |parOrder=5 |opType=mtouchin |parSummary=Deletes all lines except the heading. To clear with a script command, here is an example: opparm -c /serial1 clear |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Received Messages |pageSummary= }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Multi Touch In |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=OP Execute |long=The OP Execute DAT runs a script when the state of an [[Operator|operator]] changes. OP Execute DATs are created with default python method placeholders. For each monitored condition in the parameters, there is a [[opexecuteDAT_Class|matching python method]] in the DAT. When a condition is turned on in the parameters, each time that condition is satisfied the corresponding python method will be executed. |opType=opexec |opClass=opexecuteDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The OP Execute DAT runs a script when the state of an [[Operator|operator]] changes. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=0 |opType=opexec |parSummary=While on, the DAT will respond to the OP that is referenced. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=opexec |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=([[Operator Language|Tscript]] only) The script is executed from the current node location. |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=This Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the parent of the DAT. The DAT executes from the parent to make siblings of the DAT easy to access: DAT scripts used to execute from inside the DAT. |itemName=here }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=([[Operator Language|Tscript]] only) Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to ''Specified Operator''. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=op |parLabel=Monitor OPs |parOrder=3 |opType=opexec |parSummary=Specify which operators to monitor to trigger the scripts. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=precook |parLabel=Pre Cook |parOrder=4 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onPreCook() method is triggered before the operator is cooked. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=postcook |parLabel=Post Cook |parOrder=5 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onPostCook() method is triggered after the operator is cooked. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=opdelete |parLabel=Destroy |parOrder=6 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onDestroy() method is triggered when the operator is deleted. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=flagchange |parLabel=Flag Change |parOrder=7 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onFlagChange() method is triggered when one of the operator's [[Flags]] changes state. This includes all the flags in the Common Flags list of an [[OP_Class#Common_Flags|OP_Class]], plus all the python accessible flags listed in [[COMP_Class#Common_Flags|COMP_Class]], [[SOP_Class#Common_Flags|SOP_Class]], [[CHOP_Class#Common_Flags|CHOP_Class]]. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=wirechange |parLabel=Wire Change |parOrder=8 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onWireChange() method is triggered when the operator's inputs are rewired (connected, disconnected, swapped). |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=namechange |parLabel=Name Change |parOrder=9 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onNameChange() method is triggered when the name of the operator is changed. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=pathchange |parLabel=Path Change |parOrder=10 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onPathChange() method is triggered when the path of the operator is changed. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=uichange |parLabel=UI Change |parOrder=11 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onUIChange() method is triggered when operator is resized or moved in the network editor. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=numchildrenchange |parLabel=Number Children Change |parOrder=12 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onNumChildrenChange() method is triggered if the number of children an operator has changes. Only works with [[Component]] type operators. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=childrename |parLabel=Child Rename |parOrder=13 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onChildRename() method is triggered if a child of the operator is renamed. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=currentchildchange |parLabel=Current Child Change |parOrder=14 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onCurrentChildChange() method is triggered if a child of the operator is made current in a network. Only works with Component type operators. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=extensionchange |parLabel=Extension Change |parOrder=15 |opType=opexec |parSummary=The onExtensionChange() method is triggered when an extension of the operator is changed. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=edit |parLabel=Edit.. |parOrder=16 |opType=opexec |parSummary=Clicking this opens a text editor to edit text in the DAT. |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=OP Execute |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |opFamily=DAT |pageName=File |pageSummary= |items= {{Parameter|parLabel=File |opFamily=DAT |parName=file |parSummary=The filesystem path and name of the file to load. Accepts .txt and .dat files. |opType=text |parOrder=1 |parType=File |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Sync to File |opFamily=DAT |parName=syncfile |parSummary=When On, loads the file from disk into the DAT when the projects starts. A filename must be specified. Turning on the option will load the file from disk immediately. If the file does not exist, it will be created the first time the DAT is updated. The file is monitored so that any changes made to the file will update the DAT, and any changes made to the DAT will be written to the file right away. If the file is removed, the DAT will retain its current contents. |opType=text |parOrder=2 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Load on Start |opFamily=DAT |parName=loadonstart |parSummary=When On, reloads the file from disk into the DAT when the projects starts. |opType=text |parOrder=2 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Load File |opFamily=DAT |parName=loadonstartpulse |parSummary=Instantly reloads the file. |opType=text |parOrder=3 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Write on Toe Save |opFamily=DAT |parName=write |parSummary=When On, writes the contents of the DAT out to the file on disk when the project is saved. |opType=text |parOrder=4 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Write File |opFamily=DAT |parName=writepulse |parSummary=Instantly write the file to disk. |opType=text |parOrder=5 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary= }} }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=OP Execute |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=OP Find |long=The OP Find DAT traverses the component hierarchy starting at one component and looking at all nodes within that component, and outputs a table with one row per node that matches criteria the user chooses. For example, the criteria could be all Ramp TOPs, or all nodes whose name starts with “wave”, or all nodes with the Clone parameter set to “master1”, or all Geometry components with a tag called “emitter”. The criteria can limited to include only nodes of certain families, or certain operator types. It can filter on matching its path, certain parameters containing certain values (both constant and expressions), comments, tags, or the content of a DAT containing certain strings. You can also cause the DAT to only look to some depth of the hierarchy from the specified component, such as 2 levels down, or limitless. Criteria can be case-sensitive or not, but case-sensitive On or Off applies to all criteria in the OP Find DAT. Furthermore you can exclude some nodes using more specialized criteria by returning a True of False in a callback contained in the attached callback DAT. With the Combine Filters Menu (Any or All, Default is All), you can do an "or" or "and" on the pattern matching criterea. It also takes an optional DAT containing a list of operators (eg, another OP Find DAT) which can be used to chain filters. === Output Columns === There is a variety of columns that you can select from including name, id, paths, type and tags. (id is a member of the operator, which is an integer unique to the node, and doesn't change during the running of the TouchDesigner process.) You can also output custom columns by defining the column names in the callback DAT, and filling in the column cells via another function in the callback DAT. For example, you can output a custom column which is the tx parameter value of the node. You can control when the OP Find DAT cooks. Normally it cooks whenever any of the nodes in the specified hierarchy changes. Using the Active Cook menu parameter, you can also force-cook it every frame, or turn off cooking entirely. You can also click the Pulse parameter on Active Cook in order to force-cook it once, or do the equivalent using the node.cookpulse.pulse() python call. Instead of being give the path to a component to start at, the OP Find DAT can take an input DAT containing a pre-generated list of paths to nodes to start from, and merge the results of each input line together in the output. To use this, the input DAT should contain the node “id” as the first column, which can be generated with another OP Find DAT with the Column called “ID” turned on. For example, say you first list all components that are panels, then you separate into groups based on type or Clone parameter. The first OP Find DAT pre-filters a huge hierarchy to a small fraction of the nodes, the subsequent OP Find DATs are operating on simpler sets to eliminate a lot of checking and cooking. Refer to Help -> [[OP Snippets|Operator Snippets]]. See also: [[Script DAT]] |opType=opfind |opClass=opfindDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The OP Find DAT traverses the component hierarchy starting at one component and looking at all nodes within that component, and outputs a table with one row per node that matches criteria the user chooses. }} {{ParameterPage |items={{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=activecook |parOrder=0 |parLabel=Active Cook |opType=opfind |parItems={{ParameterItem |opFamily=DAT |parName=activecook |itemLabel=Off |itemName=off |itemSummary=This stops the operator from cooking altogether. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=DAT |parName=activecook |itemLabel=Automatic |itemName=auto |itemSummary=Only cook / update the contents when the results would change. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=DAT |parName=activecook |itemLabel=Always |itemName=always |itemSummary=Continually cook this operator repeatedly for update cases that might be missed. }}{{ParameterItem |opFamily=DAT |parName=activecook |itemLabel=Incremental |itemName=incremental |itemSummary=This will cook each frame, but only add one result per cook, until all results are added. At that point cooking stops. }} |parSummary=Determines when to cook the DAT. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=cookpulse |parLabel=Cook Pulse |parOrder=1 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Manually force the OP Find DAT to update. |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=component |parLabel=Component |parOrder=2 |opType=opfind |parSummary=The path to the component where the search starts from. |parType=COMP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=opfindDAT |parLabel=Include Component |parName=includecomponent |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=3 |parSummary=Include the component the search starts from in the search itself. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=opfindDAT |parLabel=Include Wire Hierarchy |parName=includewired |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=4 |parSummary=Any components wired to the starting component are included in the search. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=mindepth |parLabel=Minimum Depth |parOrder=5 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Set a minmum depth for the sub-components the OP Find DAT should recursively search through. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=limitmaxdepth |parLabel=Limit Max Depth |parOrder=6 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Turns on the Maximum Depth parameter to limit searching through sub-components. Turning this toggle off will search through all sub-networks. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=maxdepth |parLabel=Maximum Depth |parOrder=7 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Set the maximum depth for the sub-components the OP Find DAT should recursively search through. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=opfindDAT |parLabel=Limit Max Operators |parName=limitmaxops |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=8 |parSummary=Limit the total number of operators iterated in the search. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=opfindDAT |parLabel=Maximum Operators |parName=maxops |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parOrder=9 |parSummary=Number of operators the search is limited to. |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Component |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items={{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=objects |parLabel=Object COMPs |parOrder=0 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Include Object COMPs, like Geo COMP, in the search. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=panels |parLabel=Panel COMPs |parOrder=1 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Include Panel COMPs, like Container COMP, in the search. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=other |parLabel=Other COMPs |parOrder=2 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Include other type COMPs, like Base COMP, in the search. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=tops |parLabel=TOPs |parOrder=3 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Include DAT family operators in the search. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=chops |parLabel=CHOPs |parOrder=4 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Include CHOP family operators in the search. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |parName=sops |parLabel=SOPs |parOrder=5 |opType=opfind |parSummary=Include SOP family operators in the search. {{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=OSC In |long=The OSC In DAT receives and parses full Open Sound Control packets using UDP by default. Each packet is parsed and appended as a row in the DAT's table. The table is FIFO "fisrt-in first-out" and limited to parameter-set number of lines. An optional script may be run for each packet received. Each packet/row represents either one OSC message, or an entire OSC bundle. Each argument is translated into readable ASCII text. See also [[OSC]], [[OSC Out DAT]], [[Peer Class]], [[OSC_In_CHOP|OSC In CHOP]], [[OSC Out CHOP]], [[iOS and OSC]], [[Network Protocols]]. The supported argument tag types are: *i int32 *f float32 *s OSC-string *b OSC-blob *h 64 bit big-endian two's complement integer *t OSC-timetag *d 64 bit ("double") IEEE 754 floating point number *S alternate type represented as an OSC-string *c ASCII character *r 32 bit RGBA color *m 4 byte MIDI message *T True *F False *N Nil *I Infinitum *[ Beginning of an array *] End of an array In the case of multi-vectored arguments (example "blob", "midi", "rgb", etc), the list of values is enclosed in double quotes. In the case of unknown argument types, a quoted list of decimal values representing the bytes of that argument are included instead. '''NOTE for Windows OS - If experiencing connection issues make sure Windows Firewall is disabled.''' |opType=oscin |opClass=oscinDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The OSC In DAT receives and parses full Open Sound Control packets using UDP by default. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=4 |opType=oscin |parSummary=While on, the DAT receives information sent to the network port. While Off, no updating occurs. Data sent to the port is lost. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |parOrder=0 |parLabel=Protocol |opType=oscin |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemLabel=Messaging (UDP) |itemSummary= |itemName=msging }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemLabel=Multi-Cast Messaging (UDP) |itemSummary= |itemName=multicastmsging }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemLabel=Reliable Messaging (UDT Library) |itemSummary= |itemName=reliablemsging }} |parSummary=Select which protocol to use, refer to the [[Network Protocols]] article for more information. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=address |parLabel=Network Address |parOrder=1 |opType=oscin |parSummary=For multi-cast protocol, this is the multi-cast address to listen for. For UDT protocol this is the IP address of the server. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=port |parLabel=Port |parOrder=2 |opType=oscin |parSummary=The port which OSC-In will accept packets on. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=localaddress |parLabel=Local Address |parOrder=3 |opType=oscout |parSummary=Specify an IP address to receive on, useful when the system has mulitple NICs (Network Interface Card) and you want to select which one to use. |parType=StrMenu |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=shared |parLabel=Shared Connection |parOrder=3 |opType=oscin |parSummary=Use the same connection as other networking DATs using the same network protocol. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=addscope |parLabel=OSC Address Scope |parOrder=5 |opType=oscin |parSummary=To reduce which message are generated, you can use message address name patterns to include or exclude messages. For example, ^*accel* will exclude accelerometer messages coming in from an iOS or iPhone app like mrmr. See [[Pattern Matching]] for the syntax of the possible address name patterns. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=typetag |parLabel=Include Type Tag |parOrder=6 |opType=oscin |parSummary=Includes the argument list type tag in each message. It includes the parameter type keywords (in case the parsing application needs to identify parameter types). |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=splitbundle |parLabel=Split Bundle into Messages |parOrder=7 |opType=oscin |parSummary=When On, each message contained within a bundle is given its own row. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=splitmessage |parLabel=Split Message into Columns |parOrder=8 |opType=oscin |parSummary=When On, OSC address and arguments are given individual columns, otherwise they are included in the message column. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=bundletimestamp |parLabel=Bundle Timestamp Column |parOrder=9 |opType=oscin |parSummary=When On, each bundle timestamp value is included in a column. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Connect |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=callbacks |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parOrder=0 |opType=oscin |parSummary=The Callbacks DAT will execute once for each message received. See [[oscinDAT_Class]] for usage. |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=oscin |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the current node location. |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Callbacks DAT |itemSummary=The script is executed from the location of the DAT specified in the Callbacks DAT parameter. |itemName=callbacks }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=oscin |parSummary=The operator whose state change will trigger the DAT to execute its script when Execute from is set to Specified Operator. This operator is also the path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to Specified Operator. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clamp |parLabel=Clamp Output |parOrder=3 |opType=oscin |parSummary=The DAT is limited to 100 messages by default but with Clamp Output, this can be set to anything including unlimited. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=maxlines |parLabel=Maximum Lines |parOrder=4 |opType=oscin |parSummary=Limits the number of messages, older messages are removed from the list first. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clear |parLabel=Clear Output |parOrder=5 |opType=oscin |parSummary=Deletes all lines except the heading. To clear with a python script op(''"opname"'').par.clear.pulse() |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=bytes |parLabel=Bytes Column |parOrder=6 |opType=oscin |parSummary=Outputs the raw bytes of the message in a separate column. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Received Messages |pageSummary= }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary= }} }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=OSC In |infoChannels={{InfoChannel |chanName=messages_pending |chanSummary=}}}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=OSC Out |long=The OSC Out DAT is used for sending information over a OSC connection between remotely located computers. Use the [[OscoutDAT_Class|.sendOSC()]] python method to output the OSC messages. OSC bundles allows you to send a group of messages in a single command rather than as separate, individual messages. The OSC Out DAT sendOSC() function will accept a list of messages and send as a bundle when you set the kwarg asBundle=True. Bundles were created as a performance optimization for real-time control of synthesizers with a large number of parameters. (thx Jesse Gilbert) See also [[OSC]], [[OSC In DAT]], [[OSC In CHOP]], [[OSC Out CHOP]], [[iOS and OSC]], [[Network Protocols]], [[Sync]]. '''NOTE for Windows OS - If experiencing connection issues make sure Windows Firewall is disabled.''' |opType=oscout |opClass=oscoutDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The OSC Out DAT is used for sending information over a OSC connection between remotely located computers. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=4 |opType=oscout |parSummary=While on, the DAT receives/sends information from/to the network port. While Off, no updating occurs. Data sent to the port is lost. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |parOrder=0 |parLabel=Protocol |opType=oscout |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemLabel=Messaging (UDP) |itemSummary= |itemName=msging }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemLabel=Multi-Cast Messaging (UDP) |itemSummary= |itemName=multicastmsging }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemLabel=Reliable Messaging (UDT Library) |itemSummary= |itemName=reliablemsging }} |parSummary=Selects the network protocol to use. Refer to the [[Network Protocols]] article for more information. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=address |parLabel=Network Address |parOrder=1 |opType=oscout |parSummary=The network address of the target computer when using UDP. For multi-cast this is the multi-cast address to send to. This address is a standard WWW address, such as 'foo' or 'foo.bar.com'. You can put an IP address (e.g. 100.123.45.78). If you put "localhost", it means the other end of the pipe is on the same computer. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=port |parLabel=Port |parOrder=2 |opType=oscout |parSummary=The network port to send to. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=localaddress |parLabel=Local Address |parOrder=3 |opType=oscout |parSummary=Specify an IP address to send from, useful when the system has mulitple NICs (Network Interface Card) and you want to select which one to use. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=shared |parLabel=Shared Connection |parOrder=3 |opType=oscout |parSummary=Use the same connection as other networking DATs using the same network protocol. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=addscope |parLabel=OSC Address Scope |parOrder=5 |opType=oscout |parSummary=To reduce which channels are generated, you can use channel name patterns to include or exclude channels. For example, ^*accel* will exclude accelerometer channels coming in from an iOS or iPhone app like mrmr. See [[Pattern Matching]] for the syntax of the possible channel name patterns. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=typetag |parLabel=Include Type Tag |parOrder=6 |opType=oscout |parSummary=Includes the argument list type tag in each message. |parLabel=Split Bundle into Messages |parOrder=7 |opType=oscout |parSummary=When On, each message contained within a bundle is given its own row. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=Panel Execute |long=The Panel Execute DAT will run its script when the [[Panel Value]]s of a specified panel component changes. You can specify which panel values to monitor, and trigger scripts based on their values changing in various ways. Panel Execute DATs are created with [[panelexecuteDAT_Class|default python method]] placeholders. For each monitored condition in the parameters, there is a matching python method in the DAT. When a condition is turned on in the parameters, each time that condition is satisfied the corresponding python method will be executed. In the template Python script, panelValue is passed to each method, and you can query each call by printing panelValue.name and panelValue.val. See [[PanelValue Class]]. |opType=panelexec |opClass=panelexecuteDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The Panel Execute DAT will run its script when the [[Panel Value]]s of a specified panel component changes. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=0 |opType=panelexec |parSummary=While on, the DAT will respond to the Panel that is referenced. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=panelexec |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=([[Operator Language|Tscript]] only) The script is executed from the current node location. |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=This Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the parent of the DAT. The DAT executes from the parent to make siblings of the DAT easy to access: DAT scripts used to execute from inside the DAT. |itemName=here }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=([[Operator Language|Tscript]] only) Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=panelexec |parSummary=The path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to ''Specified Operator''. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=panels |parLabel=Panels |parOrder=3 |opType=panelexec |parSummary=Select which [[Panel Component|Panel COMPs]] to monitor for changes. |parType=COMP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=panelvalue |parOrder=4 |parLabel=Panel Value |opType=panelexec |parItems= |parSummary=The [[Panel Value]](s) that is monitored to trigger the execution of the script. Each event will only cause one trigger to go off (i.e. if both Off to On and On Value Change are checked, one event will be fired with Off to On as the trigger). Logic for the 'on' state is ''greater than zero''. |parType=StrMenu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=offtoon |parLabel=Off to On |parOrder=5 |opType=panelexec |parSummary=The onOffToOn() method executes when the panel value specified switches from off to on, called at the first "on" frame. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=whileon |parLabel=While On |parOrder=6 |opType=panelexec |parSummary=The whileOn() method executes when the panel value specified is on. Accepts .txt and .dat files. |opType=text |parOrder=1 |parType=File |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Sync to File |opFamily=DAT |parName=syncfile |parSummary=When On, loads the file from disk into the DAT when the projects starts. A filename must be specified. Turning on the option will load the file from disk immediately. If the file does not exist, it will be created the first time the DAT is updated. The file is monitored so that any changes made to the file will update the DAT, and any changes made to the DAT will be written to the file right away. If the file is removed, the DAT will retain its current contents. |opType=text |parOrder=2 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Load on Start |opFamily=DAT |parName=loadonstart |parSummary=When On, reloads the file from disk into the DAT when the projects starts. |opType=text |parOrder=2 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Load File |opFamily=DAT |parName=loadonstartpulse |parSummary=Instantly reloads the file. |opType=text |parOrder=3 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Write on Toe Save |opFamily=DAT |parName=write |parSummary=When On, writes the contents of the DAT out to the file on disk when the project is saved. |opType=text |parOrder=4 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Write File |opFamily=DAT |parName=writepulse |parSummary=Instantly write the file to disk. |opType=text |parOrder=5 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary= }} }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Panel Execute |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=Parameter Execute |long=The Parameter Execute DAT runs a script when a [[parameter]] of any operator changes state. There are 4 ways a parameter can trigger the script: if its value, expression, export, or enable state changes. Parameter Execute DATs are created with [[parameterexecuteDAT_Class#Callbacks|default python method placeholders]]. Unlike other execute DATs, the Parameter Execute DAT does not cook the node that it is watching, to avoid issues with recursive updates. |opType=parexec |opClass=parameterexecuteDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The Parameter Execute DAT runs a script when a [[parameter]] of any operator changes state. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=0 |opType=parexec |parSummary=While on, the DAT will respond to the Parameter that is referenced. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=parexec |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=([[Operator Language|Tscript]] only) The script is executed from the current node location. |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=This Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the parent of the DAT. The DAT executes from the parent to make siblings of the DAT easy to access: DAT scripts used to execute from inside the DAT. |itemName=here }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=([[Operator Language|Tscript]] only) Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=parexec |parSummary=This operator is also the path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to ''Specified Operator''. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=op |parLabel=OPs |parOrder=3 |opType=parexec |parSummary=Specify which operator(s) the triggering parameter belongs to. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=pars |parLabel=Parameters |parOrder=4 |opType=parexec |parSummary=Specify which parameter(s) to monitor for triggering the script. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=valuechange |parLabel=Value Change |parOrder=5 |opType=parexec |parSummary=The onValueChange() method executes when the parameter value specified changes value in any way.
