{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=Render Pick |long=The Render Pick DAT lets you get information about the 3D surface at any pixel of any 3D render, allowing you to implement multi-touch on a 3D rendered scene. It samples a rendering (from a [[Render TOP]] or a [[Render Pass TOP]]) and returns 3D information from the geometry at the specified pick locations. You feed it a DAT with minimum three columns: select, u and v. A [[Multi Touch In DAT]] is usually connected to the Render Pick DAT, where the Multi Touch In DAT points to a container that is displaying the output of the Render TOP. You can pick from multiple cameras simultaneously. You can specify a camera which allows the pick to occur from the point of a view other than the first camera listed in the [[Render TOP]]. The value in the column can either be a path (relative to the Render Pick DAT, or absolute) to a Camera COMP, or it can be an integer index, started at 0. If it's an index it will select the camera to use if there are multiple cameras listed in the [[Render TOP]], or if there are cameras listed in the 'Custom Pick Camera(s)' parameter. This is useful for various [[Multi-Camera Rendering]] setups, and cases such as VR where your picking isn't coming from the point of view of your eye cameras, but instead hand controllers. The pick location is a u,v (horizontal, vertical) coordinate placed in the table that you connect to the Render Pick DAT input. Each row of the input table represents one pick point to be sampled, except for the first row which contains column headings select, u and v (plus any other unused columns you want). The select, u and v columns are what you would get from a [[Panel CHOP]]. The u and v values goes 0 to 1 left to right and bottom to top, no matter what the aspect ratio of the render is. When Strategy is Always, that u,v location is always sampled and the results are displayed in the corresponding row in the Render Pick DAT output. The output table will show the path of the geometry that was picked, its position (in a choice of reference frames), surface normal (excluding bump mapping), distance from camera, texture UV coordinate, color, alpha and instance id. It properly picks surfaces with deforming vertices. There are some examples here: * [[Palette:geoPanel|geoPanel]] in the palette. * [[Palette:multiTouch|multiTouch]] in the palette under Techniques. * [http://www.derivative.ca/Forum/viewtopic.php?f=22&t=166&p=13447 Render Pick DAT Example]. See also the single-sample [[Render Pick CHOP]]. |opType=renderpick |opClass=renderpickDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The Render Pick DAT lets you get information about the 3D surface at any pixel of any 3D render, allowing you to implement multi-touch on a 3D rendered scene. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=strategy |parOrder=0 |parLabel=Strategy |opType=renderpick |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=strategy |itemLabel=While Select |itemSummary=Continuously updates values when being selected/picked. |itemName=select }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=strategy |itemLabel=Hold First Picked |itemSummary=Holds the values first returned when geometry picked. |itemName=holdfirst }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=strategy |itemLabel=Hold Last Picked |itemSummary=Holds the values last returned when geometry picked. This differs from the Continuous strategy in that it will hold the last values picked on geometry if the pick starts sampling empty space (no geometry in that part of the scene). Alternatively, using the Continuous strategy the values will be cleared to zero if the pick starts sampling empty space. |itemName=holdlast }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=strategy |itemLabel=Always |itemSummary=Continuously updates values at the location picked. |itemName=always }} |parSummary=Decides when to update values based on pick interactions. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clearprev |parLabel=Clear Previous Pick on New Pick |parOrder=1 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=This parameter is only enabled when the Strategy is set to Hold Last Picked. When this is on, starting a new pick on empty space will clear the values. When off, the last values will be held if the pick starts on empty space. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=responsetime |parOrder=2 |parLabel=Response Time |opType=renderpick |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=responsetime |itemLabel=Next Cook (Faster) |itemSummary=The values are captured on the current frame and updated next frame. Results are from the previous frame, but much faster cook times. |itemName=nextcook }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=responsetime |itemLabel=This Cook (Slower) |itemSummary=The values are captured and updated in the current frame. |itemName=thiscook }} |parSummary=Determines when the values are updated. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=pickradius |parLabel=Pick Radius |parOrder=3 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Controls the radius of the search area for the pick. If nothing is found at the pick's center it will keep searching for geometry in the search area defined by the Pick Radius. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=pickradstep |parLabel=Pick Radial Step |parOrder=4 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Used to reduce the searching within the search area. The search area is sampled at locations that correspond to 'spokes' outwards from the center pick point. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=pickcirstep |parLabel=Pick Circular Step |parOrder=5 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Used to reduce the searching within the search area. The search area is sampled at locations that correspond to 'rings' outwards from the center pick point. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=rendertop |parOrder=6 |parLabel=Render/RenderPass TOP |opType=renderpick |parItems= |parSummary=Specifies which scene to pick on, and which camera to pick from. By default the first camera listed in the [[Render TOP]] will be used for picking. Another camera can be specified with the 'Custom Pick Camera(s)' parameter, and multiple different cameras can be selected using the camera input column. |parType=TOP |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=custompickcameras |parLabel=Custom Pick Camera(s) |parOrder=7 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Picking can be done from the viewport of custom camera(s) by specifying one or more [[Camera COMP]] here. If this parameter is blank the cameras from the Render TOP are used. To pick from the viewpoint of multiple different cameras, a camera column must be specified in the input DAT. |parType=Object |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=allowmulticamera |parLabel=Allow Multi-Camera Rendering |parOrder=8 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=[[Multi-Camera Rendering]] is a faster way to render multiple passes at the same time, and is thus a speed improvement for doing many picks at the same time. This feature may not work correctly for some older [[GLSL MAT]]s made in 088 though, so this parameter allows forcing off this speed improvement if necessary. Generally it should be left on though. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=usepickableflags |parLabel=Use Pickable Flags |parOrder=9 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=When turned on only geometry whose [[Flag|Pickable Flag]] is on can be selected by the Render Pick DAT. The Pickable Flag is found on all [[Object]] components. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=includenonpickable |parLabel=Include Non-Pickable Objects |parOrder=10 |opType=renderpick |parSummary= Includes the non-pickable objects in the picking algorithm such that non-pickable objects may occlude pickable objects. For example, if there is only one pickable object in the scene with lots of additional non-pickable geometry is present, turning this parameter on will prevent the pickable object from being selected if it is behind a non-pickage object (occluded by the non-pickage object). |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=mergeinputdat |parLabel=Merge Input DAT |parOrder=11 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Appends input table to the Render Pick DATs columns. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=activatecallbacks |parLabel=Activate Callbacks |parOrder=12 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Enables Callback DAT for each pick event. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=callbacks |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parOrder=13 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Path to a DAT containing callbacks for pick event received. |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Render Pick |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=position |parOrder=0 |parLabel=Fetch Position |opType=renderpick |parItems= Columns ''tx, ty, tz''. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=normal |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Fetch Normal |opType=renderpick |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=normal |itemLabel=No |itemSummary=Do not return normal values. |itemName=no }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=normal |itemLabel=In SOP Space |itemSummary=Return normals of point picked in SOP transform space. |itemName=sopspace }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=normal |itemLabel=In World Space |itemSummary=Return normals of point picked in world transform space. |itemName=worldspace }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=normal |itemLabel=In Camera Space |itemSummary=Return normals of point picked in camera transform space. |itemName=cameraspace }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=normal |itemLabel=Relative to Object |itemSummary=Return normals of point picked relative to object specified in '''Reference Object''' parameter. |itemName=relativetoobj }} |parSummary=Returns the normals of the point picked on the geometry. Columns ''nx, ny, nz''. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=referenceobj |parLabel=Reference Object |parOrder=2 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Object used when fetching position or normals '''Relative to Object'''. |parType=Object |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=color |parLabel=Fetch Point Color |parOrder=3 |opType=renderpick |parSummary=Returns the point color of the point picked on the geometry. Some characters like ' need a \ in front of it. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=rowexpr |parLabel=Row Select Condition |parOrder=9 |opType=select |parSummary=Specify an expression that will be evaluated. If the expression evaluates to true, the row will be selected. Expand the parameter and you will see that it is in [[Parameter Mode|expression mode]]. [[File:SelectDAT_rowselectexpr.png]] By default, the [[Python]] expression is re.match('.*',me.inputCell.val) != None. '.*' means match any character multiple times, so this expression matches all values. If you want to match the parent's operator name followed by any numeric number you can use parent().name+'[0-9]*', where '[0-9]*' matches any numerical string. '.*'+parent().name+'.*' will match any cell that contains the operator's parent name. You can check [https://docs.python.org/3.3/library/re.html Regular Expression Operations] for additional information on how to use the Python Regular Expression module. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= {{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=Serial |long=The Serial DAT is used for serial communication through an external port, using the RS-232 protocol. These ports are usually a 9 pin connector, or a USB port on new machines. (Using a USB port requires a USB-to-serial adapter and driver.) All of a computer's available serial ports can be found in the Device Manager in the Windows operating system under Computer –> Manage -> Devices -> Serial… -> COM ports. Their names begin with 'COM'. Example: COM1, COM2, COM3. To send bytes out this connection, see the send methods in the [[serialDAT_Class]], or in Tscript the send Command. See also [[Arduino]] and [[Serial CHOP]]. |opType=serial |opClass=serialDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The Serial DAT is used for serial communication through an external port, using the RS-232 protocol. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parLabel=Active |parOrder=0 |opType=serial |parSummary=This check box enables the serial connection. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=format |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Row/Callback Format |opType=serial |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=format |itemLabel=One Per Byte |itemSummary=(formerly called 'binary'). |itemName=perbyte }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=format |itemLabel=One Per Line |itemSummary=(formerly called 'Ascii') null/newln delimited. |itemName=perline }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=format |itemLabel=One Per Message |itemSummary=Full incoming msg. |itemName=permessage }} |parSummary=Interpret the incoming data as binary or ASCII data. If the format is Per Byte, one row is appended for each binary byte received. If the format is Per Line, one row is appended for each null or newline delimited message received. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=port |parOrder=2 |parLabel=Port |opType=serial |parItems= |parSummary=Selects the COM port that the serial connection will use. Default port names 1 through 8 are available in the popup menu, though any name can be manually entered in this field. |parType=StrMenu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |parOrder=3 |parLabel=Baud Rate |opType=serial |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=1200 |itemSummary= |itemName=1200 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=2400 |itemSummary= |itemName=2400 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=9600 |itemSummary= |itemName=9600 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=19200 |itemSummary= |itemName=19200 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=38400 |itemSummary= |itemName=38400 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=57600 |itemSummary= |itemName=57600 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=115200 |itemSummary= |itemName=115200 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=230400 |itemSummary= |itemName=230400 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=460800 |itemSummary= |itemName=460800 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=921600 |itemSummary= |itemName=921600 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=baudrate |itemLabel=1382400 |itemSummary= |itemName=1382400 }} |parSummary=The maximum number of bits of information, including "control" bits, that are transmitted per second. Check your input device's default baud rate and set accordingly. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=databits |parOrder=4 |parLabel=Data Bits |opType=serial |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=databits |itemLabel=6 |itemSummary= |itemName=6 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=databits |itemLabel=7 |itemSummary= |itemName=7 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=databits |itemLabel=8 |itemSummary= |itemName=8 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=databits |itemLabel=9 |itemSummary= |itemName=9 }} |parSummary=This parameter sets the number of data bits sent in each. Data bits are transmitted "backwards". Backwards refers to the order of transmission, which is from least significant bit (LSB) to most significant bit (MSB). To interpret the data bits, you must read from right to left. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=parity |parOrder=5 |parLabel=Parity |opType=serial |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=parity |itemLabel=Even |itemSummary= |itemName=even }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=parity |itemLabel=Odd |itemSummary= |itemName=odd }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=parity |itemLabel=None |itemSummary= |itemName=none }} |parSummary=This parameter can be set to none, even, or odd. The optional parity bit follows the data bits and is included as a simple means of error checking. Parity bits work by specifying ahead of time whether the parity of the transmission is to be even or odd. If the parity is set to be odd, the transmitter will then set the parity bit in such a way as to make an odd number of 1's among the data bits and the parity bit. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=stopbits |parOrder=6 |parLabel=Stop Bits |opType=serial |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=stopbits |itemLabel=1 |itemSummary= |itemName=1 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=stopbits |itemLabel=2 |itemSummary= |itemName=2 }} |parSummary=The last part of transmission packet consists of 1 or 2 Stop bits. The connection will now wait for the next Start bit. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=dtr |parOrder=7 |parLabel=DTR |opType=serial |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=dtr |itemLabel=Disable |itemSummary=Disables the line when device is opened. |itemName=disable }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=dtr |itemLabel=Enable |itemSummary=Enables the line when device is opened. |itemName=enable }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=dtr |itemLabel=Handshake |itemSummary=Enables handshaking with the device. |itemName=handshake }} |parSummary=The DTR (data-terminal-ready) flow control. (Windows Only). |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=rts |parOrder=8 |parLabel=RTS |opType=serial |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=rts |itemLabel=Disable |itemSummary=Disables the line when device is opened. |itemName=disable }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=rts |itemLabel=Enable |itemSummary=Enables the line when device is opened. |itemName=enable }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=rts |itemLabel=Handshake |itemSummary=Enables RTS handshaking. |itemName=handshake }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=rts |itemLabel=Toggle |itemSummary=Line high only when bytes available. |itemName=toggle }} |parSummary=The RTS (request-to-send) flow control. (Windows Only). |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Connect |pageSummary= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=callbacks |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parOrder=0 |opType=serial |parSummary=The Callbacks DAT will execute once for each message received. |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Execute from |opType=serial |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Current Node |itemSummary=The script is executed from the current node location. |itemName=current }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Callbacks DAT |itemSummary=The script is executed from the location of the DAT specified in the Callbacks DAT parameter. |itemName=callbacks }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemSummary=The script is executed from the component specified in the Component parameter below. |itemName=op }} |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parOrder=2 |opType=serial |parSummary=The path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to Specified Operator. |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clamp |parLabel=Clamp Output |parOrder=3 |opType=serial |parSummary=The DAT is limited to 100 messages by default but with Clamp Output, this can be set to anything including unlimited. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=maxlines |parLabel=Maximum Lines |parOrder=4 |opType=serial |parSummary=Limits the number of messages, older messages are removed from the list first. |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=clear |parLabel=Clear Output |parOrder=5 |opType=serial |parSummary=Deletes all lines except the heading. To clear with a script command, here is an example: opparm -c /serial1 clear |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=bytes |parLabel=Bytes Column |parOrder=6 |opType=serial |parSummary=Outputs the raw bytes of the message in a separate column. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Received Data |pageSummary= }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Serial |infoChannels={{InfoChannel |chanName=bytes_read |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=bytes_written |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=bytes_write_queued |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=bytes_write_rate |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=messages_pending |chanSummary=}}}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=SocketIO |opFilter=False |opType=socketio |long=The SocketIO DAT connects to a [[Socket.IO]] server at the specified URL. Additional headers can be specified via the first input of the SocketIO DAT. This input should be in a table format with two columns, structured as name/value pairs. The SocketIO DAT listens to specific events that the server emits. These events are added as listeners via the second input, structured as a single column of event names. Then, when the server emits these events the onReceiveEvent callback will be triggered. The SocketIO DAT can also emit events to the server. This is done using the python emit method. Acknowledgement callbacks are not supported. The SocketIO DAT is built with [https://github.com/socketio/socket.io-client-cpp socket.io's C++ Client API] v2.0.0. Works with with socket.io v2.x servers; socket.io v3 currently not supported. The SocketIO DAT prints socket.io status messages to the TouchDesigner text console. The text console can be enabled by setting the environment variable TOUCH_TEXT_CONSOLE=1 (see: https://docs.derivative.ca/Variables#System_Environment_Variables). The text console will open the next time TouchDesigner is launched. See also: [[WebSocket DAT]], [[Web Client DAT]] |opClass=socketioDAT_Class |short=The SocketIO DAT connects to a [[Socket.IO]] server at the specified URL. |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Connect |pageSummary= |items={{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=socketio |parName=active |parOrder=0 |parSummary=When enabled, the SocketIO DAT is actively listening for events from the server, and can also emit events. |parLabel=Active |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=socketioDAT |parLabel=Reset |parName=reset |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parOrder=1 |parSummary=Disconnects the connection and then reconnects. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=socketio |parName=url |parOrder=2 |parSummary=The URL of the socket.io server. |parLabel=URL |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=socketioDAT |parLabel=Verify Certificate (TLS) |parName=verifycert |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=3 |parSummary=Enables TLS (transport layer security) certificate verification. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=socketioDAT |parLabel=Reconnect Delay |parName=delay |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parOrder=3 |parSummary=The delay in milliseconds between reconnection attempts. |parItems= }}}} {{ParameterPage |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Received Messages |pageSummary= |items={{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=socketio |parName=callbacks |parOrder=0 |parSummary=The Callbacks DAT will execute once for each message coming in. |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=socketio |parName=executeloc |parOrder=1 |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. To clear with a python script op(''"opname"'').par.clear.pulse() |parLabel=Clear Output |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=socketio |parName=bytes |parOrder=6 |parSummary=Outputs the raw bytes of the message in a separate column. |parLabel=Bytes Column |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page}} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary= }}{{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=1 |inputName= |inputSummary= }} }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=SocketIO |infoChannels=}} {{History}} {{DATNavBox|opFamily=DAT}} {{#invoke:Category|list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opLabel=SOP to |long=The SOP to DAT allows you to extract point, vertex and primitive (e.g. polygon) data and attributes from a SOP. Data is output in columns, with the first column being index. The index refers to the Point or Primitive number. [[Attribute|Attributes]] are output with column name ''attrib'' if it is a single value attribute, or with multiple columns named ''attrib''(0), ''attrib''(1), ''attrib''(2) etc. if it is a multiple value attribute. See also: [[Geometry Detail]], [[Point]], [[Point List]], [[Point Class]], [[Primitive]], [[Prims Class]], [[Polygon]], [[Vertex]], [[SOP]], [[SOP Class]], [[Script SOP]], [[Point Group]]s, [[Primitive Group]]s, [[Attributes]]. '''Example File :''' [[File:SOPtoDATtoSOP.tox]] |opType=sopto |opClass=soptoDAT_Class |opFilter=False |short=The SOP to DAT allows you to extract point, vertex and primitive (e.g. polygon) data and attributes from a SOP. |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=sop |parLabel=SOP |parOrder=0 |opType=sopto |parSummary=Specify the SOP to pull data from. |parType=SOP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=extract |parOrder=1 |parLabel=Extract |opType=sopto |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=extract |itemLabel=Points |itemSummary=Get point data. |itemName=points }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=extract |itemLabel=Vertices |itemSummary=Get vertex data. |itemName=vertices }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=extract |itemLabel=Primitives |itemSummary=Get primitive data. |itemName=primitives }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=extract |itemLabel=Detail |itemSummary=Get data for the entire geometry set. |itemName=detail }} |parSummary=Specify whether to pull point data or primitive data. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=group |parOrder=2 |parLabel=Group |opType=sopto |parItems= |parSummary=Point or primitive group to extract. If none specify all data will be extracted. |parType=StrMenu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=attrib |parOrder=3 |parLabel=Attributes |opType=sopto |parItems= |parSummary=Attributes to extract. Point specific attributes can include P and Pw for position and weight. Primitive specific attributes include vertices and close. Vertices list the point numbers in a primitive and close reports whether the primitive is a closed polygon. The index column is the point or primitive number and will always be output. |parType=StrMenu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=uvforpts |parLabel=Copy Vertex UV to Points |parOrder=4 |opType=sopto |parSummary=Copies the vertex UVs to point UVs. |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageName=SOP To |pageSummary= }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=SOP to |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

If the sort index is -1 or out of bounds, the output will be unsorted. |opType=sort |parOrder=2 |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Order |opFamily=DAT |parName=order |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Alphabetical |opFamily=DAT |parName=order |itemName=alpha |itemSummary=Use alphabetical sorting. Numbers are treated as characters, sorted by their ASCII values. }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Alphabetical with Numbers |opFamily=DAT |parName=order |itemName=alphanum |itemSummary=Use alphanumerical sorting. }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Numbers |opFamily=DAT |parName=order |itemName=nums |itemSummary=Use numerical sorting. Characters are all treated as 0, incoming order is preserved. }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Random |opFamily=DAT |parName=order |itemName=random |itemSummary=Randomly sorts the table, uses random Seed parameter below. }} |parSummary=Determines the type of sorting. |opType=sort |parOrder=3 |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Seed |opFamily=DAT |parName=seed |parSummary=The random seed when Sort Order is set to Random. |opType=sort |parOrder=4 |parType=Float |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Ignore Case |opFamily=DAT |parName=ignorecase |parSummary=Ignores case sensitivity when Sort Order is set to Alphabetical or Alphabetical with Numbers. |opType=sort |parOrder=5 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Preserve First |opFamily=DAT |parName=preservefirst |parSummary=Does not resort the first row or column (depending if Sort is set to Rows or Columns). |opType=sort |parOrder=6 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Unique Output |opFamily=DAT |parName=unique |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Off |opFamily=DAT |parName=unique |itemName=off |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Single Row/Col |opFamily=DAT |parName=unique |itemName=single |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Entire Rows/Cols |opFamily=DAT |parName=unique |itemName=entire |itemSummary= }} |parSummary=Remove duplicate rows/column entries in the sorted row/column. |opType=sort |parOrder=7 |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Reverse Output |opFamily=DAT |parName=reverse |parSummary=Reverses the sort order. |opType=sort |parOrder=8 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageSummary= |pageName=Sort }} {{:DAT Filter Common Page }} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary= }} }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Sort |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opClass=substituteDAT_Class |opType=substitute |short=The Substitute DAT changes the cells of the incoming DAT using pattern matching and substitution strings. |opFilter=True |opLabel=Substitute |long=The Substitute DAT changes the cells of the incoming DAT using pattern matching and substitution strings. It outputs a table with the same number of rows and columns. See examples below. Also you can use the second input to provide a table of strings to substitute, the first column being the "before" strings and the second column being the "after" strings. '''See also''': the Python .replace() [https://www.w3schools.com/python/ref_string_replace.asp], which is a method you can apply to any string. You can do that in an [[Evaluate DAT]] or [[Script DAT]]. |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parName=before |parLabel=Before |parSummary=Search term to replace. This replaces everything matched in the search term. string. |parName=match |opFamily=DAT }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=At End |itemName=end |itemSummary=Match the search term to the end of the string. |parName=match |opFamily=DAT }} |opFamily=DAT If the expression evaluates to true, the row will be selected. Expand the parameter and you will see that it is in [[Parameter Mode|expression mode]]. [[File:SelectDAT_rowselectexpr.png]] By default, the [[Python]] expression is re.match('.*',me.inputCell.val) != None. '.*' means match any character multiple times, so this expression matches all values. If you want to match the parent's operator name followed by any numeric number you can use parent().name+'[0-9]*', where '[0-9]*' matches any numerical string. '.*'+parent().name+'.*' will match any cell that contains the operator's parent name. You can check [https://docs.python.org/3.7/library/re.html Regular Expression Operations] for additional information on how to use the Python Regular Expression module. |parOrder=8 |opFamily=DAT {{Glossary |Title=Table DAT |Short=A form of [[DAT]]s (Data Operators) that is structured as rows and columns of text strings. |Long=}}{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Table |opFilter=False |long=The Table DAT lets you hand-edit or create a table of rows and columns of cells, each cell containing a text string. A "table" is one of the two forms of DATs (the other being simply lines of "free-form" text via the [[Text DAT]]). '''Manually editing cells''' - When a Table DAT has its [[Viewer Active]] on, you can add rows and columns by right-clicking on row 0 or column 0 to add rows/columns, and typing text into any cell of its [[Node Viewer|node viewer]]. Use the Tab key to jump to the next cell, and the up/down arrow keys to navigate to adjacent cells. '''Procedurally filling cells''' - You can conveniently create and fill rows and columns of a table. On the Fill page, the Fill Type menu gives 5 options: Manual, Set Size, Set Size and Contents, Fill by Column, and Fill by Row. When a Fill option is chosen, you can generate multiple rows/columns with specific headings using space-separated names or an expression, plus expressions to fill the cells. You can use me.subRow and me.subCol (for sub-section being filled) in your expressions. See the popup menu on the Cell Expression parameter for suggestions. Click the + below the parameters to you generate multiple sets of new cols or rows. '''Filling cells externally with python ''' - If you are not auto-filling, you can put strings into table cells using something like op('table1')[2,'select'] = 'yes' in a python script elsewhere, or append rows using .appendRow() in python. See also the [[Script DAT]] and its Snippets. '''Loading from external files''' - The Table DAT can also can load a table from a .csv, .txt or .dat file on disk or on the web. Either drag-drop the file into a network, or use the File parameter. Use http:// when specifying a table on the internet. If you drag the Table DAT to a desktop or folder, The DAT text will be converted into tab-delimited tables in a .txt file. See also [[Script DAT]], [[Text DAT]]. |opClass=tableDAT_Class |opType=table |short=The Table DAT lets you hand-edit or create a table of rows and columns of cells, each cell containing a text string. |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parLabel=Edit.. |opFamily=DAT |parName=edit |parSummary=Clicking this opens a text editor to add/edit/delete text from the DAT. |opType=table |parOrder=0 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=File |opFamily=DAT |parName=file |parSummary=The filesystem path and name of the file to load. Accepts .txt and .dat files. |opType=table |parOrder=1 |parType=File |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Sync to File |opFamily=DAT |parName=syncfile |parSummary=When On, loads the file from disk into the DAT when the projects starts. A filename must be specified. Turning on the option will load the file from disk immediately. If the file does not exist, it will be created the first time the DAT is updated. The file is monitored so that any changes made to the file will update the DAT, and any changes made to the DAT will be written to the file right away. If the file is removed, the DAT will retain its current contents. |opType=text |parOrder=2 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Default Read Encoding |opFamily=DAT |parName=defaultreadencoding |parSummary=Sets the expected file encoding format, or auto-detects the format. UTF8, UTF16-LE, UTF16-BE, CP1252 |opType=table |parOrder=3 |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=defaultreadencoding |itemLabel=Auto Detect |itemSummary= |itemName=manual }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=defaultreadencoding |itemLabel=UTF8 |itemSummary= |itemName=utf8 }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=defaultreadencoding |itemLabel=UTF16-LE |itemSummary= |itemName=utf16le }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=defaultreadencoding |itemLabel=UTF16-BE |itemSummary= |itemName=utf16be }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=defaultreadencoding |itemLabel=CP1252 |itemSummary= |itemName=cp1252 }} |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Load on Start |opFamily=DAT |parName=loadonstart |parSummary=When On, reloads the file from disk into the DAT when the projects starts. |opType=table |parOrder=4 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Write on Toe Save |opFamily=DAT |parName=write |parSummary=When On, writes the contents of the DAT out to the file on disk when the project is saved. |opType=table |parOrder=5 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Remove Blank Lines |opFamily=DAT |parName=removeblank |parSummary=When enabled, do not convert blank lines into empty rows when loading files. |opType=table |parOrder=6 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageSummary= |pageName=Table }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parLabel=Fill Type |opFamily=DAT |parName=fill |parOrder=0 |opType=table |parItems= {{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=fill |itemLabel=Manual |itemSummary=Rows and Columns will be added manually by user. |itemName=manual }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=fill |itemLabel=Set Size |itemSummary=The size will be set by the Rows and Columns parameters, but the cells will not be filled in. |itemName=setsize }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=fill |itemLabel=Set Size and Contents |itemSummary=The size will be set by the Rows and Columns parameters, and the cells will be filled based on the Cell Expression. |itemName=setsizeandcontents }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=fill |itemLabel=Fill by Column |itemSummary=The number of rows will be set by the Rows parameter, and the content of the columns will be defined by the Names 0 and Cell Expression 0 parameters. |itemName=fillbycol }}{{ParameterItem|opFamily=DAT |parName=fill |itemLabel=Fill by Row |itemSummary=The number of columns will be set by the Columns parameter, and the content of the rows will be defined by the Names 0 and Cell Expression 0 parameters. |itemName=fillbyrow }} |parSummary=You can create and fill rows and columns of a table. Fill Type menu gives 5 options: Manual, Set Size, Set Size and Contents, Fill by Column, and Fill by Row. When a Fill option is chosen, you can generate multiple rows/columns with specific headings using space-separated names or an expression, plus expressions to fill the cells. |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Rows |opFamily=DAT |parName=rows |parSummary=Defines the number of rows in the table, where applicable. |opType=table |parOrder=1 |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Columns |opFamily=DAT |parName=cols |parSummary=Defines the number of columns in the table, where applicable. |opType=table |parOrder=2 |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=cellexpr |parLabel=Cell Expression |parOrder=3 |opType=table |parSummary=Expression used to fill each cell if the Fill Type is Set Size and Contents. Can include expressions me.subRow and me.subCol |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Include Names |opFamily=DAT |parName=includenames |parSummary=Creates an extra row at the top, or a column at the left for the names of the columns or rows, filled with the Include Names parameter. |opType=table |parOrder=4 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=cellexpr |parLabel=Names 0 |parOrder=5 |opType=table |parSummary=Space-separated names of one or more columns or rows. If it is an expression, each name can be the member of a python list, like ['heading1', 'heading2']. This parameter is the start of a sequential block. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|opFamily=DAT |parName=cellexpr |parLabel=Cell Expression 0 |parOrder=6 |opType=table |parSummary=Expression used to fill each cell if the Fill Type is Fill by Row or Fill by Column. Can include expressions me.subRow and me.subCol. |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageSummary= |pageName=Fill }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Table |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opClass=tcpipDAT_Class |opType=tcpip |short=The TCP/IP DAT is used for sending and receiving information over a TCP/IP connection between two remotely located computers. |opFilter=False |opLabel=TCP/IP |long=The TCP/IP DAT is used for sending and receiving information over a TCP/IP connection between two remotely located computers. It captures all the messages without any queuing or buffering, and allows you to send it any messages you want. Send messages using the [[tcpipDAT_Class]]. Handle received messages using the callback DAT attached to the TCP/IP DAT. See [[Network Protocols]]. This DAT can be used to intercept all the raw information being sent from a Pipe Out CHOP for example. The [[Pipe In CHOP]] and [[Pipe Out CHOP]] also communicate through a TCP/IP connection, though they use a specific syntax. See also [[Peer Class]], [[UDP In DAT]], [[UDP Out DAT]]. For Tscript. see Tscript send Command. '''NOTE for Windows OS - If experiencing connection issues make sure Windows Firewall is disabled.''' |opFamily=DAT |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parOrder=0 |parName=mode |parLabel=Connection Mode |parSummary=Specify if this operator is communicating as a '''client''' or a '''server'''. |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=This Operator is Client |itemName=client |itemSummary= |parName=mode |opFamily=DAT }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=This Operator is Server |itemName=server |itemSummary= |parName=mode |opFamily=DAT }} |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parName=address |parLabel=Network Address |parSummary=If this node is communicating as a client, this should be the IP address of the server. |parOrder=1 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=port |parLabel=Port |parSummary=The network port to listen on or connect to, depending on of the node is the server or client respectively. |parOrder=2 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=shared |parLabel=Shared Connection |parSummary=Use the same connection as other networking DATs using the same network protocol. |parOrder=3 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parOrder=4 |parName=format |parLabel=Row/Callback Format |parSummary=Determines how the incoming data is parsed into the table. |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=One Per Byte |itemName=perbyte |itemSummary=One row is added to the table per byte received. |parName=format |opFamily=DAT }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=One Per Line |itemName=perline |itemSummary=One row is added to the table per line received. The end of a line is delimited by \n, \r or a null character (\0).
'''Note: In this format messages will not be logged until one of those characters are received.''' |parName=format |opFamily=DAT }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=One For All Received Data |itemName=all |itemSummary=One row is added to the table per message received. Since TCP/IP is a stream-based protocol, the end of a 'message' is arbitrary. It is simply the contents of the last read operation from the socket. If you are reading a custom message format, you'll likely need to build up a full message from multiple reads from the socket in Python. |parName=format |opFamily=DAT }} |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parName=active |parLabel=Active |parSummary=This check box enables the connection. |parOrder=5 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |pageSummary= |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Connect }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parName=callbacks |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parSummary=The Callbacks DAT will execute once for each message received. |parOrder=0 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parOrder=1 |parName=executeloc |parLabel=Execute from |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Current Node |itemName=current |itemSummary=The script is executed from the current node location. |parName=executeloc |opFamily=DAT }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Callbacks DAT |itemName=callbacks |itemSummary=The script is executed from the location of the DAT specified in the Script DAT parameter. |parName=executeloc |opFamily=DAT }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Specified Operator |itemName=op |itemSummary=The script is executed from the component specified in the Component parameter below. |parName=executeloc |opFamily=DAT }} |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parName=fromop |parLabel=From Operator |parSummary=The component who's state change will trigger the DAT to execute its script when Execute from is set to On Panel Change. This component is also the path that the script will be executed from if the Execute from parameter is set to Specified Component. |parOrder=2 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=clamp |parLabel=Clamp Output |parSummary=The DAT is limited to 100 messages by default but with Clamp Output, this can be set to anything including unlimited. |parOrder=3 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=maxlines |parLabel=Maximum Lines |parSummary=Limits the number of messages, older messages are removed from the list first. |parOrder=4 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=clear |parLabel=Clear Output |parSummary=Deletes all lines except the heading. To clear with a script command, here is an example: opparm -c /serial1 clear |parOrder=5 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parName=bytes |parLabel=Bytes Column |parSummary=Outputs the raw bytes of the message in a separate column. |parOrder=6 |opFamily=DAT |opType=tcpip |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |pageSummary= |opFamily=DAT |pageName=Received Data }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=TCP/IP |infoChannels={{InfoChannel |chanName=connections |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=messages_pending |chanSummary=}}}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Text |opFilter=False |long=The Text DAT lets you edit free-form, multi-line ASCII text. It is used for scripts, GLSL shaders, notes, XML and other purposes. "Free-form text" is one of the two forms of DATs (the other being tables of rows and columns of cells, each cell containing a text string as in a [[Table DAT]]). Text can be typed into the DAT when its [[Viewer Active]] is on, or in an external text editor. The Text DAT can get its data from a file on disk or from a file on the web. Use http:// when specifying a remote text file. See also the Execute DATs which are specialized to run their text as a script: [[CHOP Execute DAT]] runs its script when a CHOP channel changes, [[DAT Execute DAT]] when a DAT changes, [[Execute DAT]] when you start or end your TouchDesigner process or want to run a script every frame, [[Panel Execute DAT]] when a control panel changes, [[Parameter Execute DAT]] when a parameter of a node changes, and [[OP Execute DAT]] when anything else about an operator changes, including creation and deletion of nodes in a component's network. Use the [[Web DAT]] to fetch via a URL query. |opClass=textDAT_Class |opType=text |short=The Text DAT lets you edit free-form, multi-line ASCII text. |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parLabel=Edit.. |opFamily=DAT |parName=edit |parSummary=Clicking this opens a text editor to add/edit/delete text from the DAT. |opType=text |parOrder=0 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=File |opFamily=DAT |parName=file |parSummary=The filesystem path and name of the file to load. Accepts .txt and .dat files. |opType=text |parOrder=1 |parType=File |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Sync to File |opFamily=DAT |parName=syncfile |parSummary=When On, loads the file from disk into the DAT when the projects starts. A filename must be specified. Turning on the option will load the file from disk immediately. If the file does not exist, it will be created the first time the DAT is updated. The file is monitored so that any changes made to the file will update the DAT, and any changes made to the DAT will be written to the file right away. If the file is removed, the DAT will retain its current contents. |opType=text |parOrder=2 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Load on Start |opFamily=DAT |parName=loadonstart |parSummary=When On, reloads the file from disk into the DAT when the projects starts. |opType=text |parOrder=2 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Load File |opFamily=DAT |parName=loadonstartpulse |parSummary=Instantly reloads the file. |opType=text |parOrder=3 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Write on Toe Save |opFamily=DAT |parName=write |parSummary=When On, writes the contents of the DAT out to the file on disk when the project is saved. |opType=text |parOrder=4 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Write File |opFamily=DAT |parName=writepulse |parSummary=Instantly write the file to disk. |opType=text |parOrder=5 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageSummary= |pageName=File }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InputsPage |opFamily=DAT |opInputs={{OPInput |opFamily=DAT |inputIndex=0 |inputName= |inputSummary= }} }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Text |infoChannels=}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=UDP In |opFilter=False |long=The UDP In DAT is used for receiving information over a UDP connection between two remotely located computers. It captures all the messages without any queuing or buffering, and allows you to send it any messages you want. Once this DAT has received a message it can reply to the sender using the 'send' command. Using the send command before it has received a message will not work because it doesn't know where to send data yet. When in multicast mode it doesn't send out a multicast message, it sends a reply directly to the originator for the last multicast message it got. See also [[Peer Class]], [[UDP Out DAT]], [[Touch In DAT]] and [[TCP/IP DAT]]. '''NOTE for Windows OS - If experiencing connection issues make sure Windows Firewall is disabled.''' |opClass=udpinDAT_Class |opType=udpin |short=The UDP In DAT is used for receiving information over a UDP connection between two remotely located computers. |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parLabel=Protocol |opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Messaging (UDP) |opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemName=msging |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Multi-Cast Messaging (UDP) |opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemName=multicastmsging |itemSummary= }} |parSummary=Select which protocol to use, refer to the [[Network Protocols]] article for more information. |opType=udpin |parOrder=0 |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Network Address |opFamily=DAT |parName=address |parSummary=The multi-cast IP address to listen for. |opType=udpin |parOrder=1 |parType=Str |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Port |opFamily=DAT |parName=port |parSummary=The network port to listen on. |opType=udpin |parOrder=2 |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Shared Connection |opFamily=DAT |parName=shared |parSummary=Use the same connection as other networking DATs using the same network protocol. |opType=udpin |parOrder=3 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Row/Callback Format |opFamily=DAT |parName=format |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=One Per Byte |opFamily=DAT |parName=format |itemName=perbyte |itemSummary=One row is added to the table per byte received. }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=One Per Line |opFamily=DAT |parName=format |itemName=perline |itemSummary=One row is added to the table per line received. The end of a line is delimited by \n, \r or a null character (\0). }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=One Per Message |opFamily=DAT |parName=format |itemName=permessage |itemSummary=One row is added to the table per message received. }} |parSummary=Determines how the incoming data is parsed. |opType=udpin |parOrder=4 |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Active |opFamily=DAT |parName=active |parSummary=This check box enables the connection. |opType=udpin |parOrder=5 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageSummary= |pageName=Connect }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parLabel=Callbacks DAT |opFamily=DAT |parName=callbacks |parSummary=The Callbacks DAT will execute once for each message coming in. See [[udpinDAT_Class]] for usage. |opType=udpin |parOrder=0 |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Execute from |opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Current Node |opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemName=current |itemSummary=The script is executed from the current node location. }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Callbacks DAT |opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemName=callbacks |itemSummary=The script is executed from the location of the DAT specified in the Callbacks DAT parameter. }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Specified Operator |opFamily=DAT |parName=executeloc |itemName=op |itemSummary=The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below. }} |parSummary=Determines the location the script is run from. |opType=udpin |parOrder=1 |parType=Menu |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=From Operator |opFamily=DAT |parName=fromop |parSummary=The operator whose state change will trigger the DAT to execute its script when Execute from is set to Specified Operator. This operator is also the path that the script will be executed from if the Execute from parameter is set to Specified Operator. |opType=udpin |parOrder=2 |parType=OP |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Clamp Output |opFamily=DAT |parName=clamp |parSummary=The DAT is limited to 100 messages by default but with Clamp Output, this can be set to anything including unlimited. |opType=udpin |parOrder=3 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Maximum Lines |opFamily=DAT |parName=maxlines |parSummary=Limits the number of messages, older messages are removed from the list first. |opType=udpin |parOrder=4 |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Clear Output |opFamily=DAT |parName=clear |parSummary=Deletes all lines except the heading. To clear with a python script op(''"opname"'').par.clear.pulse() |opType=udpin |parOrder=5 |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Bytes Column |opFamily=DAT |parName=bytes |parSummary=Outputs the raw bytes of the message in a separate column. |opType=udpin |parOrder=6 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageSummary= |pageName=Received Data }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page }} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=UDP In |infoChannels={{InfoChannel |chanName=messages_pending |chanSummary=}}}} {{History }} {{DATNavBox |opFamily=DAT }} {{#invoke:Category |list|DATs}}

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=UDP Out |opFilter=False |long=The UDP Out DAT is used to send information over a UDP connection to/from a remotely-located computer. {{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=UDT In |opFilter=False |long='''NOTE This DAT has been removed from TouchDesigner 2021 Official builds and later.''' The UDT In DAT is used for receiving information over a [[UDT]] connection between two remotely located computers. It captures all the messages without any queuing or buffering, and allows you to send it any messages you want. UDT Streaming is a reliable, streaming, connection orientated protocol. A single server can send to multiple clients at the same time. Handle received messages using the callback DAT attached to the UDT In DAT. Send replies using the [[udtinDAT_Class]]. See also [[Peer Class]], [[UDT Out DAT]], [[Network Protocols]]. '''NOTE for Windows OS - If experiencing connection issues make sure Windows Firewall is disabled.''' |opClass=udtinDAT_Class |opType=udtin |short=The UDT In DAT is used for receiving information over a [[UDT]] connection between two remotely located computers. |opLicense=Non-Commercial }} {{ParameterPage |items= {{Parameter|parLabel=Protocol |opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |parItems= {{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Fast Streaming |opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemName=faststreaming |itemSummary= }}{{ParameterItem|itemLabel=Reliable Messaging |opFamily=DAT |parName=protocol |itemName=reliablemsging |itemSummary= }} |parSummary=Select which protocol to use, refer to the [[Network Protocols]] article for more information. |opType=udtin |parOrder=0 |parType= |parReadOnly= }} {{Parameter|parLabel=Network Address |opFamily=DAT |parName=address |parSummary=You can put an IP address to listen on (224.0.0.1). {{Summary
	|opFamily=DAT
	|opType=webclientDAT
	|opLabel=Web Client
	|opClass=webclientDAT_Class
	|opFilter=False
	|opLicense=Non-Commercial
	|short=The Web Client DAT allows you to send HTTP requests to web servers from TouchDesigner. It supports GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS and PATCH http methods.
	|long=The Web Client DAT allows you to send HTTP requests to web servers from TouchDesigner. It supports GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS and PATCH http methods.

The Web Client DAT supports various authentication types such as: basic, oauth1, oauth2.

The Web Client DAT allows for streaming from web servers.

The Web Client DAT sends HTTP requests to web servers and then outputs the response in the DAT. With streaming enabled it can stream data from a web server. 
    
When streaming is enabled, Clamp Output as Rows should be enabled. This turns the output of the DAT into a FIFO table instead of raw text. Only the last N lines will be displayed, where N is the value of the Maximum Lines parameter. This will prevent the text in the DAT from getting too larger and will keep cook-times down as a result.
    
The Web Client DAT supports sending of GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, and PATCH request methods. The Web Client DAT also supports 4 authentication methods: Basic, Digest, OAuth1, and OAuth2.

The first input is the extra headers to send in the request. It should be a table with 2 columns, structured as name/value pairs. For example:

{{{!}} border="1"			
{{!}}Content-Type			
{{!}}application/json			
{{!}}-			
{{!}}Connection		
{{!}}Close
{{!}}}	

The second input is the data/parameters to send in the request. This can be a table with two columns, structured as name/value pairs. It can also just be text, in which case it will be sent as is. If the request method doesn't have a request body (eg. GET, OPTIONS) then it will append the input to the URL as query parameters if a table, otherwise it will be sent as the request data.

{{{!}} border="1"			
{{!}}name			
{{!}}joe			
{{!}}-			
{{!}}month			
{{!}}May			
{{!}}}

The Web Client DAT is the successor to the [[Web DAT]]. 

See also: [[Web Server DAT]], [[SocketIO DAT]], [[XML DAT]], [[TCP/IP DAT]], [[WebSocket DAT]], [[Web DAT]].
    |opCategories=
	}}

{{Summary			
	|long='''Note''': Web DAT deprecated build 2019.15230, use [[Web Client DAT]]. 
    
    The Web DAT fetches pages of data from a web connection. The data should be ASCII-readable. The Web DAT will automatically uncompress any gzip compressed page transfers. XML content is formatted into a readable indented structure, versus one long line normally sent by the server. An Info DAT can be used to obtain properties of the last page retrieved.		
			
There are two main methods of retrieving a page from a web site using the Web DAT:			
* Fetch			
* Submit and Fetch			
			
The Fetch method simply fetches the page from the internet using the simple protocol "GET", while the Submit and Fetch method can be used for submitting form data to a server.  By default the latter method uses the "POST" protocol.			
			
			
Both methods allow a DAT table input to specify options while fetching.  This table should consist of rows of name/value pairs.  The first column consists of the names, while the second column consists of the values.  The Fetch method simply concatenates the pairs into the specified URL, while the Update and Fetch method posts the pairs to a webserver, before fetching the resulting page.			
			
For example, assume a table with the following contents is connected to the Web DAT:			

{{{!}} border="1"			
{{!}}name			
{{!}}joe			
{{!}}-			
{{!}}month			
{{!}}May			
{{!}}}
			
If the specified URL is:			
''http://www.example.com''			
			
Then the Fetch method will actually fetch:			
''http://www.example.com?name=joe&month=May''			
			
Similarly, the Submit and Fetch method will post the pairs to the specified webserver, before fetching the page.			
			
Note that spaces and other special characters in the table will be properly encoded. For example, each space in a name or value would be encoded as: %20			
			
The first input can also be text data, in which case the data is sent to the webserver during a POST as-is, without any formatting or encoding. If the first input is text it will be ignored during a GET operation.			
			
The 2nd input of the Web DAT can be used for custom HTTP request headers to be specified as part of the request. Like the 1st input this should be a table of name/value pairs for header field name and the value. E.g			
			
{{{!}} border="1"			
{{!}}Content-Type			
{{!}}application/json			
{{!}}-			
{{!}}Date			
{{!}}Tue, 12 Nov 2013 08:12:31 GMT			
{{!}}}			
			
Each row will automatically be merged into a single line of text separated by a colon. If the 2nd column is empty then the entry in the first column will have a semi-color append to it when it's turned into the request header.			
			
See also [[XML DAT]], [[TCP/IP DAT]], [[WebSocket DAT]].

	|short=The Web DAT fetches pages of data from a web connection.

{{Summary |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Web Server |opFilter=False |long=The Web Server DAT allows you to connect to TouchDesigner as a web client, through a web browser for example. The Web Server DAT supports HTTP, WebSockets, as well as the sending/receiving of binary data, such as images (uploading/downloading). How client requests are handled is left up to the user via callbacks. The Web Server DAT can be secure, and also supports basic authentication via the authenticateBasic in the [[webserverDAT_Class]]. Currently only Basic authentication (ie. encoded username and password) is supported via a python method. Authentication will be in the HTTP request dictionary under the key 'Authorization'. Ultimately, security is the complete responsibility of the user. It is up to the user to ensure that HTTP requests are properly authenticated, and any data storing usernames/passwords are encrypted or saved privately. HTTPS is supported via the Secure (TLS) parameter. The Web Server DAT is built with [https://github.com/pocoproject/poco POCO] v1.9.1. See also: [[Web Client DAT]] |opClass=webserverDAT_Class |opType=webserverDAT |short=The Text DAT lets you edit free-form, multi-line ASCII text. |opLicense=Non-Commercial |opCategories= }} {{ParameterPage |items={{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=webserverDAT |parLabel=Active |parName=active |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parOrder=0 |parSummary=Starts and Stops the webserver. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=webserverDAT |parLabel=Restart |parName=restart |parType=Pulse |parReadOnly= |parOrder=1 |parSummary=When the server is active, pulsing will restart it. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |parLabel=Port |opFamily=DAT |parName=port |parSummary=The web server's connection port. Eg. If the port number is 9980, the web server can be connected to locally (via a web browser) at the address "localhost:9980". |opType=webserver |parOrder=2 |parType=Int |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |parLabel=Secure (TLS) |opFamily=DAT |parName=secure |parSummary=When enabled, the web server will use transport layer security (TLS) to create secure connections with clients. As a result, the web server will run through HTTPS instead of HTTP. |opType=webserver |parOrder=3 |parType=Toggle |parReadOnly= |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=webserverDAT |parLabel=Private Key File Path |parName=privatekey |parType=File |parReadOnly= |parOrder=4 |parSummary=The path to the private key file of the server's TLS certificate. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=webserverDAT |parLabel=Certificate File Path |parName=certificate |parType=File |parReadOnly= |parOrder=5 |parSummary=The path to the certificate file of the server's TLS certificate. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=webserverDAT |parLabel=Certificate Password |parName=password |parType=Text |parReadOnly= |parOrder=6 |parSummary=The password for the certificate specified above. The password is only visually hidden and can still be accessed via python. In order to protect it and encrypt it when the project is saved, the Web Server DAT should be put in a private component. |parItems= }} {{Parameter |opFamily=DAT |opType=webserver |parLabel=Callbacks DAT |parName=callbacks |parType=DAT |parReadOnly= |parOrder=6 |parSummary=A reference to a DAT with python callbacks. The Web Server DAT relies heavily on the Callbacks DAT, and in fact most functionality passes through the callbacks. onHTTPRequest - Triggered when the web server receives an HTTP request. The request is a dictionary of HTTP headers. Similarly, response is a dictionary of response data such as status and reason. Additional key/value pairs can be added to the response dictionary that will be added as headers in the HTTP response. The response server must be returned from the callback. This response will be sent back to the client. onWebSocketOpen - Triggered when a WebSocket connection is opened with a client. The client address is passed to the callback. onWebSocketClose - Triggered when a WebSocket connection is closed. The client address is passed to the callback. onWebSocketReceiveText - Triggered when the server's WebSocket connection receives text data from a client. The client that sent the text data is passed through to the callback. onWebSocketReceiveBinary - Triggered when the server's WebSocket connection receives binary data from a client. The client that sent the binary data is passed through to the callback. onServerStart - Triggered when the server starts. onServerStop - Triggered when the server stops. |parItems= }} |opFamily=DAT |pageSummary= |pageName=Web Server }} {{:DAT Generator Common Page}} {{InfoCHOPChannels |opFamily=DAT |opLabel=Web Server |infoChannels={{InfoChannel |chanName=server_running |chanSummary=}}{{InfoChannel |chanName=websocket_connections |chanSummary=}}}} {{History}} {{DATNavBox|opFamily=DAT}} {{#invoke:Category|list|DATs}}

{{Summary
	|opFamily=DAT
	|opType=webrtcDAT
	|opLabel=WebRTC
	|opClass=webrtcDAT_Class
	|opFilter=True
	|opLicense=Non-Commercial
	|opCategories=
	|short=
	|long=A WebRTC DAT represents a peer on one end of any number of [[WebRTC]] peer-to-peer connections.

Each connection is represented in TouchDesigner by a generated UUID. The UUID must be passed to [[WebrtcDAT Class]] connection-level python methods.

The WebRTC DAT output is a table formatted with a row per connection, with columns: id (ie. UUID), [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/connectionState connection_state], [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/signalingState signaling_state], [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/iceConnectionState ice_connection_state], and [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/iceGatheringState ice_gathering_state]. 

The columns altogether describe the state of a connection and can also be useful for debugging. For example, if ice_connection_state failed then that means there's an issue pairing local and remote ICE candidates for streaming over the network. It could be that NAT traversal failed, and if using a STUN server that might indicate a need for a TURN server (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/STUN#Limitations).

WebRTC video and audio input/output is done via the [[Video Stream In TOP]], [[Video Stream Out TOP]], [[Audio Stream In CHOP]], and [[Audio Stream Out CHOP]].

See also [[WebRTC]].
	}}
